Description: Purchasing Analyst Prospective Candidate, please note: In order to be considered for the Purchasing Analyst position, the Indeed Skills Assessments selected for the position must be completed. The Assessments are emailed to you from Indeed after you have applied for the position and submitted your resume. If for any reason you do not receive them, please contact us directly and we will gladly forward them to you.About Race Technologies, LLC and the Purchasing Analyst position...We are a dynamic growth driven company in the Automotive and Motorcycle Industry that represents one of the worlds top brands in the Performance and Racing Market. We are seeking a highly qualified candidate with a positive attitude, that is eager to grow and wants to become an integral part of a team.Primary Roles / ResponsibilitiesThe primarily focus of this role is reviewing, tracking, analyzing, ordering and coordinating the flow of parts throughout our system. There will be close interaction with our Operations Team and our Primary Suppliers managing monthly stock orders and expediting time sensitive customer orders. It will be essential for the candidate to have extensive experience related to the following:Utilizing large data files with multiple product lines comprised of 20,000+ SKU'sCreating and implementing BOM's and disseminating information throughout the companyCollaborating with our existing Purchasing, Operations and Data Team Members to ensure the accuracy and validity of the data being used and resolving any anomalies prior to producing forecasts or ordering productsMaintaining a high level of accuracy and consistency in all functions related to the roleSkills / TraitsThe following skills and traits would need to come naturally to the candidate in order to successfully fulfill this role:Positive personality that is committed to help/support others on the teamStrong written and verbal communication skillsHighly detail oriented, accurate and organizedCapable of handling multiple prioritiesAble to work with a sense of urgencyEducation / TrainingEducation and experience equal to a minimum of 3 years in a dedicated Purchasing role and/or the equivalent in education related to Purchasing.Software/ToolsExcel - Advanced experience using Excel including formulas and pivot tables.Access - Advanced experience using Access a plus but not requiredNetSuite / Oracle ERP/CRM - Experience with NetSuite a plus but not requiredJob Type: Full-timePay: $50,000.00 - $75,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee discountHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:Day shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:Our two main objectives are to keep our team safe and to ensure business continuum. Throughout the pandemic, we have been pro-active during each phase and will continue to be diligent to protect our staff, customers and suppliers.Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Microsoft Excel: 2 years (Required)Purchasing: 2 years (Required)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:NoWork Location: One location

Job Title: Senior Supply Chain Market Forecast & Intelligence Lead Anal...
Description:
Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
To ensure compliance with President Biden’s September 9, 2021 executive order, Boeing is implementing a new requirement for U.S.-based employees to either show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved reasonable accommodation (based on a disability/medical condition or sincerely held religious belief) exempting them from the requirement, by December 8, 2021 (timing may vary in some states). Individuals who are unable to meet COVID-19 requirements due to a disability/medical condition or sincerely held religious belief may apply for a reasonable accommodation during the post-offer process. Individuals with approved accommodations will be subject to frequent COVID-19 testing.
Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19, or have an approved medical exception by 3 December 2021. For Victorian based employees, the compliance date is 26 November 2021.
All other global Boeing locations do not have a vaccination requirement at this time.
The Boeing Company is looking for a Senior Supply Chain Forecast and Strategy Analyst (Level 5 ) to represent Boeing Commercial Airplanes as a lead focal supporting development of a supply base and market analysis forecast. This position will lead the development of a supply chain market forecast, integrate with other forecasting teams within Boeing and plays a critical role in offering insights to leadership and Supply Chain teams to understand current market and competitive dynamics.

This position will be a telecommuting position home based in one of the listed locations. Occasional domestic and international travel is required (~10%)

Position Responsibilities:
Subject matter expert in collecting, analyzing and synthesizing market intelligence related to the creation of market forecasts directed toward supply chain.
Lead analysis and communication of significant emerging supplier trends.
Lead Collaboration with cross-functional teams to integrate market forecasts.
Train and lead other team members in creation of a supply chain market forecast.
Investigate and synthesize publicly sourced market intelligence data to create bench-marking analysis, supporting supply chain business decisions.
Develops short term and long term market forecasts to inform senior leadership and other stakeholders to aid decision making.
Develop a systemic understanding of integrated strategy in support of overall supply chain category strategies.
Experience in creating and managing comprehensive project schedules identifying time frames for key project milestones and ensuring alignment of sub tier activities for overall project visibility, tracking and completion.
Provides technical and business guidance to critical suppliers and programs.
Leads strategic supply chain activities to manage work with suppliers and programs.
Manages all aspects of supplier and stakeholder relationships and performance throughout all contract phases.
Leads supplier assessments and the development of recovery plans, corrective and preventative actions.
Leads the development of company or business unit procurement strategies.
Provides oversight, guidance and verification of work movement projects.
Communicates supplier and organization performance plans risks, issues and opportunities to stakeholders.
Manages work movement plans.

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
10+ years of experience conducting data, trend and/or forecasting analysis.
10+ years of experience in building and presenting plans or recommendations to executive leadership.
5 or more years of experience with performing strategy work -development, integration, and execution (e.g. market or competitive research and analysis, strategy development, and facilitating strategic decisions).

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Bachelor’s degree or higher.
Experience in a supply chain, technical, or engineering field.
Previous experience with forecasting industry groups
Previous experience in a team leadership role, or as a senior team member OR 3 or more years of experience leading teams in a formal and/or informal leadership role.
Previous experience as a mentor or trainer OR experience mentoring, coaching, guiding, and leading teams.

Typical Education/Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 14 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+9 years' related work experience, Master+12 years' related work experience, 18 years' related work experience, etc.).

Relocation:
Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

“At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary pay range: 95,130 – 176,670"

Position Summary:


A Penske Logistics Sr. Financial Analyst is responsible for the company’s financial forecasting, annual planning, operating plan variance analysis and special projects. The position provides financial consulting and support to operations personnel as well as senior management. The analysis includes preparing financial presentations, analyzing operating data and client P&Ls as well as other ad hoc reporting. This is a hands on role that requires the analyst to work directly with the operations personnel by getting involved to understand and improve the business.

Major Responsibilities:


Perform required monthly financial close related activities including preparing required journal entries to ensure accuracy and compliance
Analyze financial information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for decision making purposes
Update and monitor key performance indicators and key financial metrics, highlighting trends and analyzing variances, to understand and be able to communicate the financial health of each location
Work with the operations team to develop annual budgets, monthly forecasts, and KPI reporting, including financial performance, variance explanations, and cost analysis
Provide senior management and the operations team with in-depth financial analysis of actual spend to drive insights on trends, investment areas and opportunities to optimize costs, driving better decision making
Deliver ad hoc reporting and analysis
Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance
3-7 years experience in financial planning, analysis, or modeling
Strong analytical skills required
Logistics/Operations experience preferred
Must be able to exercise moderate independent judgment with direction from supervisor
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required; Proficient in use of other MS Office products
Detail oriented and highly analytical, able to translate data and trends into clearly understandable messaging
Highly organized and self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and ability to thrive as part of a financial management team
Strong understanding of the importance of hands on collaboration with the Operations team and the personnel at the Area, Region and Corporate levels
Quality program certification (Six Sigma, ISO, LEAN, etc.) preferred
Some travel is required
Complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening are required

Physical Requirements:

The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The associate will be required to read, communicate verbally and/or in written form, remember and analyze certain information, and remember and understand certain instructions or guidelines.
While performing the duties of this job, the associate may be required to stand, walk, and sit. The associate is frequently required to use hands to touch, handle, and feel, and to reach with hands and arms. The associate must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25lbs/12kg.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

About Penske Logistics

Penske Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Penske Truck Leasing. With operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia, Penske Logistics provides supply chain management and logistics services to leading companies around the world. Penske Logistics delivers value through its design, planning and execution in transportation, warehousing and freight management. Visit www.PenskeLogistics.com to learn more.

About this OpportunitySince 1981, Stephen Joseph has been dedicated to creating fun and unique gifts while delivering service to our customers which exceeds their expectations! We are committed to staying true to the core values on which the company was founded: we focus on the details, we produce the highest quality products, and we believe in making our customers happy! Stephen Joseph, Inc. is currently experiencing double digit growth and is looking to expand its workforce.Stephen Joseph Companies is currently seeking a qualified inventory analyst with previous experience in inventory management and supply chain management. We are seeking a highly motivated, organized, detail oriented individual to ensure that we maintain a healthy fill rate across multiple divisions.Job Responsibilities & FunctionMonitors, investigates, and analyzes all aspects of inventory; recommends changes to inventory levels and projection management.Reviews inventory levels, creates purchase orders, communicates directly with overseas suppliers, and follows each purchase order through the entire supply chain: Inventory analysis to receipt of goods.Audits and reconciles inventories, including variance reports and computer inventory adjustmentsResearches and resolves complex inventory discrepancies.Analyzes inventory metrics and recommends improvementsAnalyzes inventory levels in order to maintain inventory integrityAnalyzes surplus/excess inventory across the system and facilitates the sale/movement of inventory to surplus customersResponsible for all communication related to our supply chain: Weekly updates to our internal sales force, daily reports to our overseas staff in China, and daily interaction with our Operations Manager to ensure timely receipt of all purchase ordersAssist and manage inventory projections for all large key accountsAssist in inventory forecasting at 3, 6, and 12 monthsRequired Knowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesBachelors degree in applicable department5+ years of inventory experienceManagement experience is a plusAdvanced skills using all Microsoft products, especially ExcelPrevious ERP / WMS experience requiredExcellent organization and time management skills requiredAbility to effectively manage multiple projects and present information clearly and accuratelyMust live in or be willing to relocate to Lubbock. No remote candidates will be considered.Salary: DOEJob Type: Full-timeSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:inventory: 5 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Location:Lubbock, TX (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:NoWork Location: One location

Job summary
Play a leading role in operational risk improvement at Amazon.com, where we have a tradition of leading the world in innovative technologies and services. Amazon is seeking an experienced Logistics/Auto Risk Analyst who will manage auto physical damage (APD) and property damage (PD) claims for Amazon’s expanding worldwide delivery fleet.

Key job responsibilities
Within the Risk Management Team, you will support and report to a Risk Manager, focusing on claims management, process improvement, and third party administrator (TPA) programs. Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:


Claims management of commercial APD and PD claims.
Work closely with the TPA to make continued improvements involving APD and PD claims, while supporting simplicity, efficiency, and cost containment.
Provide support to the TPA by confirming Delivery Service Partner information, Flex driver status, and initiating claims as needed by leveraging internal tools.
Develop solutions that will enhance the customer experience by driving change through automation and technology.
Serve as a subject matter expert for internal teams and vendors.
Support internal audits for ensuring quality and compliance in accordance with client service instructions and best practices.
Report out on audit findings, while being able to provide guidance and solutions to the TPA.
Utilize metrics and benchmarking to evaluate trends and make recommendations for process improvements and/or performance management.
Lead claim reviews with the TPA that focus on driving resolution for specifically targeted claims.
Available for domestic travel up to 25%
Fleet or commercial auto claims experience
Experience appraising auto physical damage or handling total loss claims
Auditing experience within a claims organization
Confidently work cross-functionally and vertically within in an organization
ARM, AIC, CPCU, or similar designation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

The Role
Tesla is seeking a deeply process oriented, experienced, and self-driven Logistics Analyst to support international and domestic distribution of component vehicle parts. You will work cross-functionally with global supply chain, warehousing, material planning, channel planning, service, finance, and production control to grow and manage Tesla’s service distribution network.
Responsibilities:
Facilitates and coordinates with logistics carriers and customs brokers regarding all aspects of inbound transport service of international air and ocean freight including but not limited to tracking, expediting, final mile, and receipt confirmation taking ownership of the life cycle.
Establishes operational procedures for activities such as verification of incoming shipments and on-time/ delivery performance.
Arranges deliveries for inland transportation and follows up to ensure shipments have reached their final destinations.
Lead and measure processes to ensure logistics operations are completed with excellence.
Develop strong interaction, in and amongst service providers, and the internal team to ensure fluid, efficient movement of shipments.
Take the lead in solving any problems that occur with shipments, and make sure that all parties who need to be kept updated receive timely updates
Liaise between truckers, internal customers, and delivery locations for final delivery of ocean shipments.
Maintains thorough understanding of regulations and laws affecting international transport of cargo.
Pull data from internal database. Analyze, compile, and publish logistics dashboards and metrics for Tesla’s logistics leadership.
Identify service issues trends and escalate them to the Logistics Manager
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain or the equivalent of experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
Familiar & experienced with NVOCC & freight forwarding operations.
Ability to write, speak, and present effectively and persuasively at all levels.
Strong analytical and organizational skills; ability to achieve success in situations with high degrees of variation and complexity.
Self-driven initiative to gain and implement a broad knowledge of logistics best practices.
Manage multiple priorities simultaneously, have a strong drive - orientated on result.
Desire to grow and take on increased scope of responsibility.

Description
Why should you join the Bath and Body Works ?
Bath and Body Works is the leader in personal care and beauty specialty retail. Bath and Body Works Logistics is the engine that powers our success by providing solutions that get product to her worldwide. We offer a fun healthy culture with opportunities to develop and grow. Our associates are our greatest asset. That’s why it is our commitment to ensure talent – the growth, development and recognition of our people – is always a top priority.
The Engineering Analyst leads maintenance of existing engineered labor standards and/or contributes to assigned engineering projects related to fulfillment logistics, supply chain operations, and infrastructure. The Analyst performs supporting work for larger initiatives being managed by Facilities Engineering team members. Typical areas of work include: applied industrial engineering principles, database queries and analysis, facility and process design, space and labor utilization planning, LEAN process improvement, and material handling automation design.

Responsibilities:
Maintain, develop, and deploy accurate engineered labor standards including evaluation of best method across various distribution center job functions
Analyze existing distribution process using industrial engineering tools in order to evaluate impact on labor standards. Collaborate with business partners to communicate and implement labor standards changes.
Conceptual design of new processes, including estimates of labor standards, productivity, and capacity.
Investigate and recommend methods improvement, cost reduction, and capacity enhancement options
Support methods training methodology, program, and implementation
Consult and support business partner execution of labor planning, scheduling, productivity trend tracking, and reporting.
Perform relational database administration and statistical analysis
Demonstrate excellent data analytic skills, clearly communicate results and recommended next steps to internal and external business partners
Assist in material handling equipment design, procurement, and installation with oversight from senior members of engineering team

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering or other related discipline
1-3 years of experience in distribution or manufacture engineering role
Experience with labor management, Manhattan Associates preferred
Understanding of work measurement methodologies and tools; MOST certification preferred
Knowledge of LEAN process improvement principals, green belt certification preferred
Strong analytical, problem solving, and communication skills
Flexible work schedule
Effectiveness in working within a team/matrix organization
Understanding of warehousing and Physical Distribution Processes a plus
Membership in IIE, PMI, CLM a plus
Experience with MS Office suite, scheduling, relational databases, Microstrategies Visualization, AutoCAD, simulation software, and work measurement software preferred

An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual's race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected category recognized by state, federal or local laws. We only hire individuals authorized for employment in the United States.

The Role
Tesla is seeking a deeply process oriented, experienced, and self-driven Logistics Analyst to support international and domestic distribution of component vehicle parts. You will work cross-functionally with global supply chain, warehousing, material planning, channel planning, service, finance, and production control to grow and manage Tesla’s service distribution network.
Responsibilities:
Facilitates and coordinates with logistics carriers and customs brokers regarding all aspects of inbound transport service of international air and ocean freight including but not limited to tracking, expediting, final mile, and receipt confirmation taking ownership of the life cycle.
Establishes operational procedures for activities such as verification of incoming shipments and on-time/ delivery performance.
Arranges deliveries for inland transportation and follows up to ensure shipments have reached their final destinations.
Lead and measure processes to ensure logistics operations are completed with excellence.
Develop strong interaction, in and amongst service providers, and the internal team to ensure fluid, efficient movement of shipments.
Take the lead in solving any problems that occur with shipments, and make sure that all parties who need to be kept updated receive timely updates
Liaise between truckers, internal customers, and delivery locations for final delivery of ocean shipments.
Maintains thorough understanding of regulations and laws affecting international transport of cargo.
Pull data from internal database. Analyze, compile, and publish logistics dashboards and metrics for Tesla’s logistics leadership.
Identify service issues trends and escalate them to the Logistics Manager
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain or the equivalent of experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
Familiar & experienced with NVOCC & freight forwarding operations.
Ability to write, speak, and present effectively and persuasively at all levels.
Strong analytical and organizational skills; ability to achieve success in situations with high degrees of variation and complexity.
Self-driven initiative to gain and implement a broad knowledge of logistics best practices.
Manage multiple priorities simultaneously, have a strong drive - orientated on result.
Desire to grow and take on increased scope of responsibility.

High School Diploma
1+ years of Supplier Management, Supply Chain or Logistics Industry experience
1+ years of experience with Microsoft Excel and Word

At John Deere, we run so life can leap forward. This powerful purpose is our promise to humankind that we will dream, design and deliver breakthrough products that sustain our world for generations to come. The world is counting on us to feed billions of people and build vital infrastructures in villages, towns, and megacities. We live up to the legacy our founder forged in a one-room blacksmith's shop nearly two centuries ago by creating a culture that brings out the best in all of us. A culture where great ideas thrive because every voice is heard.
Primary Location: Estados Unidos (US) - Illinois - Milan
Function: Supply Management / Logistics
Title: International Logistics Analyst (49200401) - 79621
Onsite/Remote: Onsite Position
Your Responsibilities
As an International Logistics Analyst for North America Parts Distribution Center located in Milan, IL, you will be responsible for the air export movement and documentation of service parts to local units and/or overseas marketing units, factories, and dealers/customers. More specifically, you will:
Prepare export documentation, forwarding and invoicing instructions
Manage the customer/partner profile to ensure that products are exported in a timely manner with proper documentation to the receiving party and in compliance with all order regulations
Serve as a liaison between overseas marketing units, employees, and 3rd Party Logistics Providers
Identify, develop, analyze, and publish metrics for the procurement and export process
Visa sponsorship is NOT available for this position.
What Skills You Need
Understanding of Export Order Fulfillment Process
Skilled in interpersonal communications, negotiation, and conflict resolution
Work experience in a team environment
Ability to influence without authority
What Make You Stand Out
Experience working in a warehouse, production, or manufacturing environment
Experience in specific areas of Supply Management such as: supplier integration, strategic supply management, supplier development, module supply management, scheduling, forecasting, logistics, etc.
Education
Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:
Business, Management, or a similar discipline

At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide — making the impossible happen every single day.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
As a Senior Global Logistics Analyst, you will be a key team member on the Global Logistics Product Management team! Your focus will be to support Global Transportation’s strategy of building a flexible transportation network by leading global EDI/API integration projects between Nike systems, our inbound logistics visibility platform, outbound integrations and our logistics services partners.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
You will partner with multi-functional and cross-Geography teams to develop standard operating procedures and maintain best practices to enable greater future speed and flexibility. This requires technical capability as well as the ability to creatively seek for sophisticated problems. You will also support Nike’s inbound logistics products by recommending solutions to gaps and support implementation of new products or features.
WHAT YOU BRING
Minimum of five years of professional experience in a logistics role.
Bachelor's degree or an additional two years of experience in lieu of degree.
Proven track record working in a multi-functional, global, multi-team environment.
Experience with data management in ERP systems (i.e. SAP, Oracle, etc).
Project management and influencing skills with the ability to communicate effectively with senior leadership.
Experience with and/or ability to quickly learn complex systems
Experience implementing international transportation systems, including business requirements collecting, vendor selection, and leading critical paths

THE POSITION
If you are an organized, analytical individual looking for a fast-paced position within the Office of Income Maintenance, this job could be for you. This position is based in the virtual area of OIM and serves the OIM Processing Centers and Customer Service Centers. If you enjoy problem-solving and working independently, apply now!
DESCRIPTION OF WORK
This position serves Area 7 in the Office of Income Maintenance Bureau of Operations. Area 7 focuses on supporting County Assistance Offices through the Processing Centers (PCs) and Customer Service Centers (CSCs). The incumbent in this position will work at the direction of the Area Manager of Area 7 and will take on a multitude of tasks relating to the current workload of the PCs and CSCs.

For more information, please review the position description.
Full-time employment
Work schedule: Monday through Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm, with a one-hour lunch period
You will have the opportunity to work from home (telework) full-time. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Danville.

Minimum Experience and Training Requirements: One year of professional experience developing, implementing, or evaluating human services, social services, health care services, or health care insurance programs; and a bachelor’s degree; OR An equivalent combination of experience and training that includes one year of professional experience developing, implementing, or evaluating human services, social services, health care services, or health care insurance programs.

Job Description:
Raytheon Intelligence and Space is seeking an effective candidate who will be responsible for a variety of tasks related to Pack/Ship, the Packaging Documentation Center (PDC) and final product sign off. This position is required to process contractual shipments into the Customer acceptance system for final customer buyoff and generate various types of government shipping documents (DD250/WAWF, DD1149, DD1348, CBL, SPE, etc.), commercial shipping documents (shipping memos, bills of lading, air-bills, etc.) using APEX/PRISM (SAP) and interface with DCMA Transportation for shipping labels and carrier scheduling. Additionally this candidate will be responsible for communicating and interfacing with both internal and external customers on product sell off and shipping status attending meetings in support of current and forecasted shipments and processing Shipping Requests, communicating with the requesters if additional information is needed or if there is any concern with information that was provided. The successful candidate will be responsible for monitoring, creating, and approving Transportation Requests (TR) based on received shipping requests, provide carrier quotes for proposals, be trained in the shipment of classified, hazardous, and sensitive technology items. The position also monitors and creates Commercial Bills of Landing (CBL) and Small Package Express (SPE) shipments using DCMA's ETA system and Raytheon’s Transportation Management System (Shipping Smart), updating shipment information in systems of record, and submitting Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Shipping Instruction Requests (SIR) to the government processes Government Bill of Lading (GBL) and maintain logs, file documents, and other administrative duties as required.
Required Skills:
2+ years of Logistics experience
US citizen with Secret clearance or ability to obtain
Must be willing and able to work overtime as needed
Experience in Transportation-related activities
Knowledge of industry-standard shipping processes
Knowledge of GFM /GFE material
Advanced computer skills, and proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
Strong communication skills, both written and oral, in order to communicate with internal and external customers
Must be able to multitask while working in a fast paced environment
Ability to work with limited supervision
Highly detail oriented
Maintain a safe working environment and wear proper PPE
Strong organizational and reconciliation skills
Ability to distinguish the difference between GFM and Non-GFM
Trained in the shipment of classified, hazardous, and sensitive technology items
Ability to read contracts and IOTs
Ability to maintain Shipping Service Level Commitments (SLCs)
Ability to manage changing priorities
Desired Skills:
Knowledge of Transportation Management System Matrix
Experience in Mil-Spec packaging experience
Knowledge of Raytrak
Knowledge of PRISM/SAP/APEX
Knowledge of SRM system
Knowledge of Windchill / PDM
Required Education (including Major):
Bachelor Degree (B.S. or B.A)
This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.
191790

Position Overview
The exports analyst position will primarily focus on creating commercial documents, validating commercial invoices, working with established forwarders for pickup. The role will also communicate to internal and external partners providing status updates on commercial invoice completion.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Generate commercial invoices utilizing established systems and process to support business needs
Work closely with business partners to execute to month end forecast needs by supporting CI creation and validation
Partner with distribution center shipping teams to ensure customer collections executed to agreement
Support inter company transfers with CI creation shipping to APAC & EMEA
Support store commercial documents need when shipping to international customers
Work with global customs compliance team in streamlining and maintaining exports compliance
Work with account services to ensure all proper requirements are obtained prior to orders being created in SAP
Support with providing documentation needed for shipments of samples, fabrics, and misroutes.
Experience, Skills & Knowledge
 Previous knowledge in commercial invoice/documents generation
 Working experience with exports responsibility
BI system knowledge (Qlikview) & (Qliksense)
PKMS systems knowledge used to generate orders for exports
International logistics general knowledge
SAP knowledge is a plus
General knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access Database
Logistics Analyst, Exports

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide — making the impossible happen every single day.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
As a Senior Global Logistics Analyst, you will be a key team member on the Global Logistics Product Management team! Your focus will be to support Global Transportation’s strategy of building a flexible transportation network by leading global EDI/API integration projects between Nike systems, our inbound logistics visibility platform, outbound integrations and our logistics services partners.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
You will partner with multi-functional and cross-Geography teams to develop standard operating procedures and maintain best practices to enable greater future speed and flexibility. This requires technical capability as well as the ability to creatively seek for sophisticated problems. You will also support Nike’s inbound logistics products by recommending solutions to gaps and support implementation of new products or features.
WHAT YOU BRING
Minimum of five years of professional experience in a logistics role.
Bachelor's degree or an additional two years of experience in lieu of degree.
Proven track record working in a multi-functional, global, multi-team environment.
Experience with data management in ERP systems (i.e. SAP, Oracle, etc).
Project management and influencing skills with the ability to communicate effectively with senior leadership.
Experience with and/or ability to quickly learn complex systems
Experience implementing international transportation systems, including business requirements collecting, vendor selection, and leading critical paths

Facebook is seeking an experienced Field Logistics Analyst to focus on Data Center Field and Warehouse operations. This person will be responsible for supporting the regional field leads to develop and implement consistent processes. This position requires communication skills, collaboration, a natural orientation to process analysis and optimization, the understanding of logistics processes and systems, and experience with data analysis and project management.


Develop, refine, and maintain documentation that captures and distributes the processes and policies for executing safe, effective logistics operations in Facebook data centers
Identify gaps in operations and present solutions to standardize operations across the data center regions
Build and support cross-functional relationships with internal partners drive effective communication channels supporting operations management
Help produce monthly audit of compliance to ensure meeting all inventory controls
Support month/quarter and year end requirement to ensure appropriate financial reporting
Enable and support leaders to understand business requirements, implement new processes and contribute to ongoing process improvements
Drive inventory reconciliation process to identify risk, manage obsolescence, and correct errors impacting product movement
Support improving operational and system gaps from the various warehouse and vendor entities to meet all compliance requirements
Raise the visibility of field issues that require better systemic controls to central logistics for the development of improved processes
Work with field leads, vendors and contract labor to develop and execute action plans in the implementation of these new processes
Develop a dynamic logistics operations assessment program to ensure consistent implementation and sustainment of processes across all field entities
Generate metrics highlighting performance and trends within the data center field and warehouse operations
Support the execution of Sarbanes-Oxley requirements, analyze discrepancies and help working teams develop root cause corrective actions and trend improvements
Help define and manage ongoing KPI’s to measure process compliance and logistics operations performance
Partner in developing shared solutions when inconsistencies are identified
10% travel required


Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, operations management, business management and/or any other business-related field, or equivalent work experience
Knowledge in as-is/to-be business process mapping, gap analysis, requirements elicitation and data analysis
Experience working independently, prioritizing, and managing one's time
Experience with ERP, TMS, CMS, WMS systems – Oracle, Excel or any other analytics tools
Communication, problem solving, and interpersonal experience


Experience in a data center environment
Experience in business analysis/program management

Job summary
Play a leading role in operational risk improvement at Amazon.com, where we have a tradition of leading the world in innovative technologies and services. Amazon is seeking an experienced Logistics/Auto Risk Analyst who will manage auto physical damage (APD) and property damage (PD) claims for Amazon’s expanding worldwide delivery fleet.

Key job responsibilities
Within the Risk Management Team, you will support and report to a Risk Manager, focusing on claims management, process improvement, and third party administrator (TPA) programs. Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:


Claims management of commercial APD and PD claims.
Work closely with the TPA to make continued improvements involving APD and PD claims, while supporting simplicity, efficiency, and cost containment.
Provide support to the TPA by confirming Delivery Service Partner information, Flex driver status, and initiating claims as needed by leveraging internal tools.
Develop solutions that will enhance the customer experience by driving change through automation and technology.
Serve as a subject matter expert for internal teams and vendors.
Support internal audits for ensuring quality and compliance in accordance with client service instructions and best practices.
Report out on audit findings, while being able to provide guidance and solutions to the TPA.
Utilize metrics and benchmarking to evaluate trends and make recommendations for process improvements and/or performance management.
Lead claim reviews with the TPA that focus on driving resolution for specifically targeted claims.
Available for domestic travel up to 25%
Fleet or commercial auto claims experience
Experience appraising auto physical damage or handling total loss claims
Auditing experience within a claims organization
Confidently work cross-functionally and vertically within in an organization
ARM, AIC, CPCU, or similar designation

Location: Remote, East Coast
The Inventory Control Analyst will work with distribution teams, as well as cross functional stakeholders in the organization, to create dashboards, tools, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that describe inventory trends within the organization. They will also lead efforts and drive strategic projects directly related to improving these KPIs. This role requires you to acquire deep subject matter knowledge about systems, distribution, and fulfillment processes and KPIs used to manage and drive the business. It is essential that you can think strategically, connect the dots in the bigger picture, as well as be comfortable in the details of the deliverables to drive operational improvements. The role is expected to simultaneously handle multiple projects of department-level scale and global reach.
Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and monitor all key functions related to inventory transactions to ensure that they are accurate and timely (from and to all external and/or internal operations)
Develop and supply strategic reporting to the Operations team, including: quarterly summaries, monthly trends, week-over-week analysis, and daily reporting
Develop trend reporting on top inventory offenders in all functions of the warehouse for inaccuracies to help operations leadership in seeking to understand root causes
Innovate and maintain cycle count programs in a perpetual inventory environment at all sites globally
Perform thorough research and documentation on inventory discrepancies (to identify root causes and supply possible solutions)
Develop and drive departmental and organizational goals through data analysis with the ability to speak to multiple levels of the business
Take a high level of ownership of site training and team development based around inventory, with the goal of preventing inaccuracies
Daily reporting on variance trends on site including top offenders by username per function, top bins with discrepancies, top pick zones with errors, and any additional root cause investigations
Consolidate quarterly, monthly, and weekly summaries of inventory adjustments, including: inventory discrepancies, write offs, variances, and overall value trends.
Identify process and system gaps, and highlight areas for optimization/automation with the goal of driving projects to improve these areas.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Finance, Supply Chain, Analytics, or Industrial Engineering (or relevant experience)
Preferred: 2+ years work experience in finance, supply chain, operations, or inventory control/management
Advanced skills in the Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Project
Advanced skills using SQL, PowerBI, Tableau is a plus

Join The North Face Family
The North Face was built on a love for the outdoors and the desire to enable all types of exploration, for all people, from their backyards to the Himalayas. Over the last 50 years we've lived by our “true north,” the belief that exploration has the power to change us, to challenge us and to help us see the world from new perspectives. To help ignite a global movement of outdoor exploration, love for the natural world and an unwavering commitment to protect it, we welcome and encourage new participants to the outdoors. We extend our reach through support of non-profit organizations, establishing programs that connect participants with close-to-home recreation opportunities, and creating a connection with young leaders, inspiring them to explore and conserve.
As we enter our sixth decade, we pledge to:
Empower exploration and the thrill of the unknown for as many people as possible.
Protect the places where we live, play, and operate.
Evolve the way we make our products by improving our environmental performance and social responsibility in the supply chain.
*As of October 18, 2021, this position requires proof of being fully vaccinated for COVID-19 on the first day of employment, absent need for medical or religious accommodations or other exemptions as allowed by state and local law. Further information is provided during the recruitment process.
Analyst, Supply Chain
What You Will Do
The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for the creation of Season Global Sample buys as well as creating, managing, tracking and recapping sample buy process. The Supply Chain Analyst will also support the multi-year horizon plan (MHP) data analysis to link the financial plan to operations supply chain capabilities.
How You Will Make A Difference
Manage the Sample Buy process for all global regions, create seasonal calendars and templates, create and manage buy file, and provide weekly updates to sample buys
Support the MHP project through data analysis and dashboard creation; will be required to combine and interpret large data sets from multiple sources
Responsible for maintaining and validating the data (single version of truth) for the Sample Buy and MHP across multiple departments
Coordinate and communicate updates cross-functionally (e.g., sales ops, supply planning, global sourcing, and logistics)
What You Bring
1+ years of related professional experience
BA/BS and a minimum of 1 year of professional business experience.
Proficient PC, systems and strong Excel skills are required.
Possess strong analytical and communication skills, and the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of supply chain and database applications is a plus.
Process oriented with a continuous improvement mindset
Ability to work independently on a large volume of simultaneous workstreams, and you must be motivated, flexible, and detail oriented to meet the demands of a fast-paced and passionate working environment.
VF Guiding Principles: Live with Integrity, Act Courageously, Be Curious, Act with Empathy, and Preserve.

Contact vendors and branches to coordinate cash orders

Job Title: Finance Analyst, North America Amazon Logistics
Description:
BA/BS in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or a highly analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, and Computer Science)
3+ years of finance experience or a related analytical field

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. Operations is at the heart of what we do, delivering millions of packages each day and fulfilling customer orders from all over the world. Amazon is seeking a Financial Analyst to help lead and oversee critical functions for Amazon Logistics – our rapidly expanding internal delivery operation, purpose-built to achieve and exceed the delivery quality and speed demands of Amazon customers.
The Financial Analyst for North America Amazon Logistics will play a key role in disruptive new transportation initiatives, with a focus on business partnering, strategic decision support, financial controllership and cost reduction.

This individual will collaborate with multiple stakeholders to provide timely analysis, insightful guidance, and financial leadership to this high-growth organization.

This role requires extensive cross-functional partnership with various retail, transportation, and finance teams to identify best practices across the network and lead cost improvement efforts. Contributions include lead long term strategic planning, annual planning, variance analysis for monthly/quarterly business reviews, and ad-hoc projects and analysis as needed.

Key Responsibilities:

Proven ability to develop strategic relationships with your business partners – you influence the decisions. Demonstrated ability to root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues using data, then assist, consult with, and teach the business how decisions affect costs in their sites and create new mechanisms, as they are needed.
Expertise in collecting, analyzing and managing quantitative data and creating meaningful analyses to lead business improvement and cost reductions.
Recommend, develop, and implement policies and programs that guide the organization in maintaining and improving its competitive position and profitability.
Create a “learn by doing” environment by engaging with on-the-floor associates and managers to promote and encourage continued customer focus.
Partner with your team and develop weekly and monthly financial close activities, planning, forecasting, and reporting models while overseeing their continuous innovation and communication to both your operations & other business partners.
Ensure timely and accurate metrics and forecasts are created and maintained.
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results
Demonstrated ability to build and manage financial models for business forecasting, variance analysis, and problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work with business leaders to deliver results, including the ability to persuade with data.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, SQL and other analytical tools

Overview

The Logistics Analyst is responsible for freight analysis, carrier performance, system maintenance, and other various logistics tasks.
Primary Responsibilities

Process freight claims based on shipping discrepancies
Facilitate intercompany stock transfer order (STO) process
Analyze and provide recommendations on freight costs to support product margin price decisions
Research, identify and recommend lead time variability opportunities for improvement measures
Execute state to state product transfers
Monitor carrier performance based on scheduled pickup and delivery times
Ensure SAP parameters are set correctly and communicated to all carriers
Determine potential cost saving methods to pick up product from different vendors in same regions
Route import shipments effectively, optimizing container space
Communicate shipment exceptions to internal business stakeholders
Perform other related duties as assigned

The Role
Tesla is looking for a Logistics Analyst to work on the most advanced vehicle distribution model in the world. Candidates for this job have a strong eye for detail, can provide quick and strategic solutions, ability execute large scale plans, adapt to sudden changes, manage difficult and complex challenges, and work collaboratively with excellent oral and written communication skills. We are looking for self-motivated team players interested in creating an excellent customer experience through delivering Tesla product from the factory to the future owner. Candidates must have a positive attitude and extreme determination in order for us to build an advanced vehicle distribution network capable of scaling to support the fastest growing automotive company in history. We seek individuals who value customer satisfaction and are available to work outside of the typical 9-5, Monday-Friday working hours. This job will require some nights and weekends and admittedly many responsibilities not listed below.
ResponsibilitiesEnsure premier service throughout the shipment process including quick response to inquiries and problem resolution.Drive excellent performance with 3rd party logistics partners and internal teams.Conduct regular meetings with 3rd party logistics partners and internal teams.Ensure that export process is in compliance with company and industry quality assurance standards (CI, Customs, etc.).Prepare required documentation (Ocean Bill of Lading, Shipping Instruction, IMO, etc.) for import and export functions.Develop and coordinate processes and systems to efficiently move goods to and from intermediary hubs and final destinations.Train teams on best practices and implement and operate a unified distribution handbook.Mitigate “one-offs” but know how and when to partner and execute unique requests.Issue statistical or detailed reporting for Stakeholders as requested.Maintain and update CMP, rate sheets, routing plans, etc.Coach utilization of Tesla Logistics Mobile Application to Drivers and Internal teams.Booking & coordination of most cost effective and efficient means to transport goods within expected requirements to meet or exceed expectations.Process and correct miscellaneous accounting issues.Close shipments and filing.
Data entry and analysis.
RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Supply Chain or the equivalent of experience and evidence of exceptional ability.2+ years of experience in Logistics.Experience with railroad and trucking of automotive freight preferred.Excellent computer skills, especially in Excel, MySQL, Tableau, and other database systems.Knowledge of general freight forwarding terms and standards and Incoterms.Basic knowledge of accounting functions and relative information retrieval.Ability to travel up to 10%

Location: Remote, East Coast
The Inventory Control Analyst will work with distribution teams, as well as cross functional stakeholders in the organization, to create dashboards, tools, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that describe inventory trends within the organization. They will also lead efforts and drive strategic projects directly related to improving these KPIs. This role requires you to acquire deep subject matter knowledge about systems, distribution, and fulfillment processes and KPIs used to manage and drive the business. It is essential that you can think strategically, connect the dots in the bigger picture, as well as be comfortable in the details of the deliverables to drive operational improvements. The role is expected to simultaneously handle multiple projects of department-level scale and global reach.
Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and monitor all key functions related to inventory transactions to ensure that they are accurate and timely (from and to all external and/or internal operations)
Develop and supply strategic reporting to the Operations team, including: quarterly summaries, monthly trends, week-over-week analysis, and daily reporting
Develop trend reporting on top inventory offenders in all functions of the warehouse for inaccuracies to help operations leadership in seeking to understand root causes
Innovate and maintain cycle count programs in a perpetual inventory environment at all sites globally
Perform thorough research and documentation on inventory discrepancies (to identify root causes and supply possible solutions)
Develop and drive departmental and organizational goals through data analysis with the ability to speak to multiple levels of the business
Take a high level of ownership of site training and team development based around inventory, with the goal of preventing inaccuracies
Daily reporting on variance trends on site including top offenders by username per function, top bins with discrepancies, top pick zones with errors, and any additional root cause investigations
Consolidate quarterly, monthly, and weekly summaries of inventory adjustments, including: inventory discrepancies, write offs, variances, and overall value trends.
Identify process and system gaps, and highlight areas for optimization/automation with the goal of driving projects to improve these areas.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Finance, Supply Chain, Analytics, or Industrial Engineering (or relevant experience)
Preferred: 2+ years work experience in finance, supply chain, operations, or inventory control/management
Advanced skills in the Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Project
Advanced skills using SQL, PowerBI, Tableau is a plus

Facebook is seeking an experienced Field Logistics Analyst to focus on Data Center Field and Warehouse operations. This person will be responsible for supporting the regional field leads to develop and implement consistent processes. This position requires communication skills, collaboration, a natural orientation to process analysis and optimization, the understanding of logistics processes and systems, and experience with data analysis and project management.


Develop, refine, and maintain documentation that captures and distributes the processes and policies for executing safe, effective logistics operations in Facebook data centers
Identify gaps in operations and present solutions to standardize operations across the data center regions
Build and support cross-functional relationships with internal partners drive effective communication channels supporting operations management
Help produce monthly audit of compliance to ensure meeting all inventory controls
Support month/quarter and year end requirement to ensure appropriate financial reporting
Enable and support leaders to understand business requirements, implement new processes and contribute to ongoing process improvements
Drive inventory reconciliation process to identify risk, manage obsolescence, and correct errors impacting product movement
Support improving operational and system gaps from the various warehouse and vendor entities to meet all compliance requirements
Raise the visibility of field issues that require better systemic controls to central logistics for the development of improved processes
Work with field leads, vendors and contract labor to develop and execute action plans in the implementation of these new processes
Develop a dynamic logistics operations assessment program to ensure consistent implementation and sustainment of processes across all field entities
Generate metrics highlighting performance and trends within the data center field and warehouse operations
Support the execution of Sarbanes-Oxley requirements, analyze discrepancies and help working teams develop root cause corrective actions and trend improvements
Help define and manage ongoing KPI’s to measure process compliance and logistics operations performance
Partner in developing shared solutions when inconsistencies are identified
10% travel required


Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, operations management, business management and/or any other business-related field, or equivalent work experience
Knowledge in as-is/to-be business process mapping, gap analysis, requirements elicitation and data analysis
Experience working independently, prioritizing, and managing one's time
Experience with ERP, TMS, CMS, WMS systems – Oracle, Excel or any other analytics tools
Communication, problem solving, and interpersonal experience


Experience in a data center environment
Experience in business analysis/program management
Experience handling project management responsibilities (prioritization, planning, scheduling, status reporting)
Experience in cross-functional projects across multiple teams
Knowledge in Supply Chain process from Procure-to-Pay
Knowledge with Supply Chain and Inventory management models

Principal analyst for all financial and project analytics related to the support of international logistics merchandise flow. Analytics will include end-to-end costing alternatives of the international supply chain, in-transit accounting variances, and financial and service trending analytics. Analyst will also serve as the principal architect of all international reporting and the liaison to I.T. in development of international systems.
Ability to handle & prioritize multiple tasks, and responsibly ensure proper completion of tasksStrong ability to effectively communicate with both internal and external partners including international partnersExtensive knowledge of Excel spreadsheets and Access databases including ability to design templates, queries, tables, forms, and reportsStrong ability to analyze and decipher significant amounts of data to develop insights and conclusions for the businessBasic knowledge of general financial, and accounting principlesBasic knowledge of merchandising, distribution, domestic transportation, and supply chain conceptsStrong business acumen around the cost components of international flow of merchandise including cargo consolidation/deconsolidation operations
Business Analytics (35%)
o Analyze freight flow cost reduction opportunities by studying steamship line rates at lane level, MQC (Minimum Quantity Commitment), transit times, and delivery performance
o Perform monthly MQC studies to understand future impacts to both contracts and expenses
o Assist leadership at annual contract negotiation with steamship lines, brokers, etc. by providing periodic updates of comparative rate studies at detailed level
o Conduct transit time and delivery performance studies of international flow by port location to identify opportunities in inventory reduction, or performance improvement
Reporting & Tool Development (20%)
o Analyze and report all key international financial indicators and trends. Identify potential gaps or opportunities in indicators and provide recommendations to leadership
o Design scorecards to monitor key business areas financial and delivery performance including business partner reviews
o Work with I.T. to automate manual processes
Strategic Project Development (20%)
o Assist with planning and implementing cost savings initiatives such as consolidation programs, high-cube container usage, import center locations, and deconsolidation center programs
o Research and evaluate industry software designed to improve efficiencies in the Global Supply Chain
o Partner with domestic and international operations for continued process improvement opportunities such as dray selections, port locations, etc.
Financial & Accounting Processes (15%)
o Perform month end in-transit functions including the reporting, auditing, and distribution of financial numbers
o Ensure all SOX documentation is maintained and business process are in compliance with company standards
o Establish and maintain budget processes, documentation, and variance reports
o Identify and process all claims and chargebacks associated to international product flow including consolidation
3rd Party Provider Data/Tool Management (10%)
o Ensure all data utilized from Expeditors and Cleartrack systems is accurate and is provided timely
o Work with providers to enhance reports and data extracts for continuous improvement
o Assist semi-annual reviews of providers for service performance

The Role:
As a Data Analyst on Tesla’s logistics team, you will be responsible for accessing, modeling, and visualizing data as a thought partner to the logistics team.
Responsibilities:
Experience or capacity to build models, query data across multiple SQL databases, and conduct rigorous quantitative analysis.
Generate data visualizations based on requirements from different stakeholders, including operations, finance, and other non-logistics business units.
Work closely with operations team members to define, measure, and track key performance indicators, measuring operational performance and outcomes.
Conduct research and data collection as part of ad hoc analysis requests, enabling business and operations units to conduct data-driven root cause analysis.
Analyze key drivers of logistics performance and identify prioritized actions for reducing vehicle dwell time, optimizing lane transit time, and minimizing vehicle re-routings and exceptions.
Work closely with third party logistics providers to quantify milestones and goals and develop reporting triggers based on partner performance.
Determine optimal benchmarks to enable operations decision-making: for example, when to send low-density shipments.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, supply chain, data science, or mathematics; or equivalent experience or evidence of exceptional ability.
2+ years’ experience working with business systems, data analytics, or robust quantitative analysis.
Exceptional analytical skills in logistics, data visualization, and the ability to derive important information from data.

Experience or capacity to build data models, query data sources, clean data, and synthesize analysis in clear language, accessible to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to define problems, collect relevant data, extract meaning from data, and draw logical and coherent conclusions.

This salaried position that will be supporting our business ERP transformation over the next couple of years and beyond. If you are looking for a great time to join, now’s the time!
Location: 184 Shuman Blvd, Naperville, IL 60563

We are looking to hire an entry level Industrial Engineer who will help drive business efficiency across our North American manufacturing and distribution footprint. Aspects of the role include working with manufacturing and distribution personnel to improve supply chain processes, assisting with the implementation of a standard ERP system across all facilities, and performing data analysis to improve business productivity.

If you like to work in a friendly, fast paced environment, work on many projects simultaneously and are great at communicating, this could be the right opportunity for you. In this role you will:

Help us look into our business processes - You will be a part of making our business better by uncovering opportunities for improvements, developing and implementing the solutions.
Show us your leadership skills - You'll be a part of conducting meetings and presentations to show what's been found. You also get to share ideas with teammates and a variety of stake holders. Good communication is key.
Get to know our facilities - You'll visit our manufacturing and distribution facilities across the US, Mexico and Canada. If you are bi-lingual in Spanish, that is a plus!
Meet new people and build up your social skills - You’ll get to work with various teams and people at all levels of the organization to collaborate ideas or share findings.
Use your data skills and improve them - You’ll be able to perform analysis, develop optimization strategies, document what you see.
Be an active contributor - Participate in component and data architecture design, performance monitoring, product evaluation and buy vs. build recommendations.
Let’s use your IE degree - Testing IT solutions by developing system integration test plans and scripts and/or performing and analyzing tests.
 and come join us today! #workattops

Who MIRROR is
MIRROR is the world’s first nearly invisible home gym featuring live and on-demand fitness classes in a variety of workout genres, and 1:1 personal training. We’ve created a new category of in-home fitness with cutting-edge hardware, responsive software, and best-in-class content that transforms any room into a complete home gym. For the first time, the essential components of a great studio workout-variety, personalization, and community-are brought to the most convenient place: the home.
In 2020, MIRROR joined the lululemon family. Shoppers can now experience MIRROR in 200 stores and counting across North America. Operating as an independent entity while having the resources of a public, global company behind us, we’ll continue to grow rapidly with amazing workout content and in-home fitness innovation.
We’re an inclusive space for all identities and are committed to keeping that foundation intact during this rapid growth.
Do you see yourself here? Learn about the role and challenge below!
The Role & You
Reporting to the Logistics Manager, you will be a primary day-to-day logistics and warehousing contact for the business and will support all relevant relationships and processes both inside and outside of the company. Your initial focus will be on domestic middle mile transportation, but as you gain expertise may grow to include parcel, warehousing, fulfillment, and international logistics for both Inbound and outbound freight. You will be responsible for securing the capacity that we need, managing performance, and controlling costs. You will partner with Member Experience, Supply Planning, and Procurement and will interface with teams responsible for managing final mile logistics.
Your success in this role will primarily be measured on the following Metrics: Adherence of Overall Warehousing and Transportation Spend vs Budget Fulfillment, Warehousing, & Transportation Performance vs SLA’s OTIF Percentage to Last Mile Hubs
REQUIREMENTS Detail oriented individual who takes personal ownership of deliverables Strong Excel skills (Pivot Tables, Data Analysis, Scorecarding, etc) Capable of managing multiple partners, particularly via phone Creativity in problem solving in a fast-paced, start-up environment Project management experience Previous Logistics experience

Facebook is seeking an experienced Field Logistics Analyst to focus on Data Center Field and Warehouse operations. Help produce monthly audit of compliance to ensure meeting all inventory controls

Drive inventory reconciliation process to identify risk, manage obsolescence, and correct errors impacting product movement
Support improving operational and system gaps from the various warehouse and vendor entities to meet all compliance requirements

Work with field leads, vendors and contract labor to develop and execute action plans in the implementation of these new processes
Develop a dynamic logistics operations assessment program to ensure consistent implementation and sustainment of processes across all field entities
Generate metrics highlighting performance and trends within the data center field and warehouse operations
Support the execution of Sarbanes-Oxley requirements, analyze discrepancies and help working teams develop root cause corrective actions and trend improvements
Help define and manage ongoing KPI’s to measure process compliance and logistics operations performance
Partner in developing shared solutions when inconsistencies are identified
10% travel required
