Logistics Planning Operations Analyst(Job Number: AHM00060L)

American Honda Motor Co., Inc.

Description
Honda has a clear vision for the future in 2030, and it's a joyful one! We are looking for people with the individual skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals. We are seeking diversity of thought and experience to drive innovation and help us make fully informed.
The purpose and function of the Logistics Planning Operations Analyst is the sole management of offsite storage operations including a $3M operating budget to maintain ~$250M in offsite inventory. Management includes developing strategy and determining annual budget and presenting to executives for approval. Making daily decisions to maintain adequate space in our network. Interfacing with outside off-site warehouse vendors as the face of Honda and key decision maker and negotiating contract costs and conditions. Managing day-to-day operations overseeing inbound and outbound transfer of inventory to all offsite locations. This position must determine future direction by working with sales team, understanding future growth of division, analysing space requirement, and ensuring necessary space for future, within our network as well as outside warehouse facilities. This position is required to prepare information and present to PS&T Executives often on the status of our network space.
This position is responsibility to negotiate, in collaboration with corporate procurement, 3rd party offsite storage contracts on behalf of Honda, analysing market data to ensure cost agreement is correct. This position is responsible for offsite inventory systems creation and maintenance to track and account for all inventory, held in third party offsite and reconciled daily. This position is responsible to manage team responsible for inventory discrepancies, lead the investigation and approve adjustments in compliance with SOX regulations, working with auditors, as primary Honda source, to ensure full compliance. This position is responsible to manage team to analyse network inventory data and make critical decisions to determine most efficient and cost-effective use of offsite capacity. This position is responsible to manage at least one contingent employee to assist in daily operations. In addition, multiple supply chain projects are assigned to this position as part of overall supply chain improvement initiatives to ensure the Parts Division goal of exceeding customer delivery expectations. Improvements range from inventory level adjustments across all 9 Part Centers and 5 hubs to working with suppliers on direct shipments to Honda Part Centers.
The Logistic Planning Department is uniquely positioned between operations and SPPC and therefore is subject matter expert in many areas. This position must have a challenging spirit and be proficient in decision making. This position is required to lead a team to gather and analyse difficult datasets to find answers to difficult problems using creative methods and seeking new technology for improved analytics. Root cause analysis and clear and concise communication of the problem up to executive level is a requirement. As the systems lead within Logistics Planning this position requires a skill set that makes them subject matter expert in data extraction and therefore brings a level of autonomy to the work. Responsible as ISD liaison this position must lead/test new system modifications and report on progress. Position is required to present data analysis to management including executive level presentations in a logical, relatable format.
Secondary responsibilities include completion of the Annual Space Study, a multi-year look into the future direction of the company and space requirements, data analysis for internal and external requests, and supporting capital budget. AHM has a complex supply chain utilizing offsite storage as part of the strategy to limit capital investment. This position is key in that strategy. This position must present to highest level of PS&T executives, be a representative to Honda to outside entities, and able to strategize future direction of our company through their recommendations and study.
At Honda, our associates take pride in their responsibilities. A typical day for a Logistics Planning Operations Analyst will include:
Offsite budget and cubic feet target
Project Timeline and Budget
Adequate space available in Honda PC / Hub network
Audit (SOX) Compliance

Qualifications
We are looking for qualified people and diverse background and experiences, open minds, and a Logistics Planning Operations Analyst disciplined work ethic, to bring the future to Honda as a, you must have:
Degree in Information Technology, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Operations, or equivalent experience
Equivalent 5-years work experience
Strong knowledge of Honda PC / Hub network operations and Honda systems (WMS)
Strong computer skills including Extensive Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, Visual Basic for Application and Java Programming Languages.
Trouble Shooting knowledge and developer skills with VBA, Java, Access, WEBi, SQL, Visual Fox Pro, Clockwork with JavaScript, HTML5
Proficient in Business Objects
Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills
Advanced math, statistical, inventory, forecasting skills and knowledge

American Honda Motor Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicant for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

Join The North Face Family
The North Face was built on a love for the outdoors and the desire to enable all types of exploration, for all people, from their backyards to the Himalayas. Over the last 50 years we've lived by our “true north,” the belief that exploration has the power to change us, to challenge us and to help us see the world from new perspectives. To help ignite a global movement of outdoor exploration, love for the natural world and an unwavering commitment to protect it, we welcome and encourage new participants to the outdoors. We extend our reach through support of non-profit organizations, establishing programs that connect participants with close-to-home recreation opportunities, and creating a connection with young leaders, inspiring them to explore and conserve.
As we enter our sixth decade, we pledge to:
Empower exploration and the thrill of the unknown for as many people as possible.
Protect the places where we live, play, and operate.
Evolve the way we make our products by improving our environmental performance and social responsibility in the supply chain.
*As of October 18, 2021, this position requires proof of being fully vaccinated for COVID-19 on the first day of employment, absent need for medical or religious accommodations or other exemptions as allowed by state and local law. Further information is provided during the recruitment process.
Analyst, Supply Chain
What You Will Do
The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for the creation of Season Global Sample buys as well as creating, managing, tracking and recapping sample buy process. The Supply Chain Analyst will also support the multi-year horizon plan (MHP) data analysis to link the financial plan to operations supply chain capabilities.
How You Will Make A Difference
Manage the Sample Buy process for all global regions, create seasonal calendars and templates, create and manage buy file, and provide weekly updates to sample buys
Support the MHP project through data analysis and dashboard creation; will be required to combine and interpret large data sets from multiple sources
Responsible for maintaining and validating the data (single version of truth) for the Sample Buy and MHP across multiple departments
Coordinate and communicate updates cross-functionally (e.g., sales ops, supply planning, global sourcing, and logistics)
What You Bring
1+ years of related professional experience
BA/BS and a minimum of 1 year of professional business experience.
Proficient PC, systems and strong Excel skills are required.
Possess strong analytical and communication skills, and the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of supply chain and database applications is a plus.
Process oriented with a continuous improvement mindset
Ability to work independently on a large volume of simultaneous workstreams, and you must be motivated, flexible, and detail oriented to meet the demands of a fast-paced and passionate working environment.
VF Guiding Principles: Live with Integrity, Act Courageously, Be Curious, Act with Empathy, and Preserve.

VF is one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish through our family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands. At the heart of our journey lies our company-wide purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. It’s a commitment shared by our global associates across all brands. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Company: Herdt Consulting, Inc.
An excellent opportunity with a highly successful, Veteran-Owned Small Business (VOSB). Every day, our clients trust Herdt to help navigate their most complex business and organizational challenges. We partner with our clients at all levels to ensure all business objectives are fully realized. Herdt provides project management, process and leadership support as well as specialized technical support to the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) and other Federal agencies. Herdt employees are accomplished individuals who have served as hands-on leaders in the U.S. military and private industry - We hire the best. Our employees lead some of the most complex enterprise business systems and business processes through implementation and sustainment. We are valued for our technical knowledge, business process expertise and industry best-practice solutions.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Oversees tasking requirements, evaluates current logistics AIS operations and instructs subordinates. Develops, analyzes, and conducts operational research and audits.
Reviews AIS software packages, source documents, and establish policies to determine format- and-design requirements.
Prepares follow-up reports evaluating effectiveness of system implementations.
Determines topics, target audiences, and resources necessary to develop and present Naval logistics courses.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in management information systems, information technology, information science, business, computer science, mathematics, or related quantitative science field
Eight years of experience in computer analysis, Navy AISs functional analysis, networks and programming; plus, two additional years as a senior-level analyst working under a formal quality management system.

Position Requirements:
In order to be considered for this position you must complete the job questionnaire that is part of the online application process.
US Citizenship is required.

Overview:

LMI is a consultancy dedicated to powering a future-ready, high-performing government, drawing from expertise in digital and analytic solutions, logistics, and management advisory services. We deliver integrated capabilities that incorporate emerging technologies and are tailored to customers’ unique mission needs, backed by objective research and data analysis. Founded in 1961 to help the Department of Defense resolve complex logistics management challenges, LMI continues to enable growth and transformation, enhance operational readiness and resiliency, and ensure mission success for federal civilian and defense agencies.

LMI is seeking a skilled Logistics Analyst with experience in Maintenance and Readiness and data analytics. The maintenance and readiness analyst will serve as a team member on one or more tasks and will be expected to perform independent analysis when appropriate.
Responsibilities:
Conduct analyses of data on a variety of topics related to maintenance/logistics management for equipment, systems and sub-systems (e.g., cost and availability studies of aircraft, vehicle, and ship fleets) as well as industrial operations (e.g., maintenance organization, production, resources, reliability, programming, and financial management).
Use spreadsheets and database tools (such as SQL or Vertica) to carry out analyses.
Assist in the development of analytical and simulation models of supply and logistics operations.
Plan and execute research project plans focused on asset performance management and concepts and integration.
Communicate the results of studies and analyses to clients through written reports and oral presentations.
Attend client-sponsored forums and conferences; attend/participate in technical tracks related to maintenance/logistics management of equipment and infrastructure.
Qualifications:

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, statistics, systems engineering, industrial engineering, or other related business or quantitative discipline required.
Working knowledge of U.S. Department of Defense or U.S. Military Service structure, management, and operations.
Experience in weapon systems maintenance, logistics operations, or supply chain or inventory management required.
Experience using spreadsheets and databases required.
2-5 years of relevant work is required.
Working knowledge of the Acquisition and Sustainment portfolio within the Department of Defense.
Experience with Python is desirable.
Superior communication skills, both oral and written.
Applicants for this position may be subjected to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Please note that only US Citizens are eligible to obtain security clearances.
Available for occasional travel.
DESIRED SKILLS
Master’s degree or higher.
Working knowledge of QLIK

The Supply Logistics Analyst functions as part of Supply Chain Logistics department and focuses on IOPS resources needed to meet the manufacturing production schedule, supports special project in the area and performs data analytics that impact overall supply chain projects. This position requires knowledge in supply planning, forecasting, in addition to inventory management.
A typical day might include the following :
Ensures requirements across IOPS and Tarrytown are identified and that all material demand is being managed.
Participates in Demand Reviews, Supply Reviews and IPS processes to ensure issues are identified and supply risk mitigated where needed.
Engages with QA/QC/Manufacturing/Procurement to coordinate availability of material and components for manufacturing.
Ensures production and shipping activities meet manufacturing requirements and resolves complaints or eliminates delays associated with site supply and components.
Creates PO Requisition and maintains inventories of materials and supplies vital to meet production demands.
Communicates requirements through monthly forecast to the supply base ensuring future product requirements identified through IPS are managed and forecasted.
Performs and designs data analytics that impact overall supply chain.
Builds advanced ad-hoc queries and reports to capture and present information effectively to support development of Supply Chain processes.
Designs or assists design of Excel/SharePoint models, tools, templates and analytics to identify and improve reporting efficiency to allow access to the routine reports and ad hoc information requests for all the supply chain stakeholders.
Creates and publishes KPIs to improve Supply Chain process efficiency.
Works collaboratively and effectively with various internal and cross-site business units to identify and align on critical initiatives that improve process, technique and execution.
Strengthens relationship and works with key stakeholders to develop consigned inventory/vendor managed programs in line with inventory stocking policies.
Assists with regular operational meetings; represents supply chain at cross-functional and partner meetings.
Completes reports required to support supply chain team including open order reporting, inventory reports, etc.
Prepares invoices that reflect the contents, pricing and destination for application to each package that is shipped.
Education and Experience:
Associate Analyst: Requires bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain Management or Science background or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Analyst: Requires bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain Management or Science background and 2 years of experience in Supply Chain Management or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Senior Analyst: Requires bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain Management or Science background and 5 years of experience in Supply Chain Management or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Pharmaceutical or biotechnology experience a plus.
Master’s degree a plus.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong analytical and interpersonal skills.
Able to prioritize and re-prioritize as needed and adapt to change.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced setting.
Relationship builder with customers and internal key partners.
Comfortable in ambiguous environment and ability to translate ambiguity into concrete steps.
Courage to ask the right questions in a cross-functional setting.
Proficiency in MS Office, Excel, Oracle, Power Point and Access Database.
Continuous improvement focus.
Lean/Continuous Improvement knowledge a plus.
APICS or other related purchasing certifications a plus.

Operates and maintains an efficient inbound material pipeline that supports the plant production schedules to meet customer service objectives. Minimize the cost of supply by helping to reduce losses due to obsolescence, aged inventory and transportation costs involved in delivering the packaging to the plant. Maintain inventories at optimal level that balances use of working capital against the risk of disruption to production. Communicate effectively between plants, suppliers, supply activity analysts, planners, commercial buyers and other functions to manage changes and exceptions. This role also serves as a Inbound team lead for key Commercial Operations projects.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Logistics, Transportation, Operations, or Supply Chain required
1-2 years of materials planning, purchasing and logistics planning or internship experience in a manufacturing setting
Understandings of supply chain and manufacturing process
Business and project management experience in a corporate setting
What will be your key responsibilities?
Ensure that all plants have inventory to support production schedule while reducing inventory investment.
Determine packaging order quantity needs based on combination of production demand forecast, historical usage, pipeline inventory level and other key inputs such as run-out estimate and EOQ etc.
Place orders with suppliers and maintain order status information up to date in system.
Schedule packaging order releases with suppliers. Follow through the order to ensure timely and complete delivery to sites. Maintain order information accuracy in system.
Manage inventory levels for assigned sites or customers to make the best use of allocated space and capital while minimizing the inventory risks due to obsolescence and interplant transfer freight cost.
Consolidate orders to minimize LTL shipments from suppliers and between sites.
Working with Commercial, suppliers and sites to ensure lead-times, safety stock levels and economic order quantities are consistent with best practices.
Collaborate with suppliers, sites, operations planning as well as other functions to develop cost effective and efficient approach to resolve packaging shortages at sites.
Manage packaging supply and inventory ramp-up/ramp-down for transition items. Maintain close and clear communication with key stakeholders to ensure changes to packaging, plant schedules and/or supplier sourcing options do not cause service disruptions.
Assist with disposition of damaged materials and replacement of rejected shipments.
Understand the operation process, capacity and delivery constraints of suppliers and sites and communicate effectively to both external parties and internal functions.
Challenge data / directions from production schedules, initial order quantity, run out analysis and others in order to make the best decision for the business
Coordinate the packaging run outs for transitions to new packaging.
Work cross-functionally on new projects.
Record issues affecting packaging supply chain. Drive continuous team improvements on process, collaboration and other areas
Resolve related invoice issues

Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Job Summary
Provide acquisition logistics support for a variety of logistics information management applications. Provide skilled professional guidance and assistance to the acquisition workforce (Team Leads, Systems Engineers, Life Cycle Logisticians).
Essential Functions:
Support sustainment planning, implementation, and execution
Provide Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) services IAW DoD regulation and policy such as DoDI 5000.02 and DoDI 5000.75
Perform tasks related to the development, operation, evaluation, and improvement of Defense Business Systems (DBS) supportability and/or maintainability programs
Research and compile logistics assessment information, assist in the development and updates to Sustainment Support documentation to include the Life Cycle Sustainment Plan (LCSP) and Capability Support Plans (CSP) IAW DoDI 5000.02, DoDI 5000.85, DoD Instruction 5000.75, and DoDI 5000.87, and program SOPs
Assist with development of logistics acquisition and sustainment documentation that includes but is not limited to Service Level Agreements (SLAs), Contract Data Requirement Lists (CDRLs), Market Research Reports, Performance Requirement Summaries (PRS), and Acquisition Strategies
Evaluate the ILS elements for products that require government approval such as LCSP, CSP, Core Logistics Assessment (CLA), Business Case Analysis (BCA), and Integrated Logistics Assessment (ILA)
Prepare and provide input into the formulation of short and long-range logistics and product support planning
Support logistics audits and audit readiness testing by maintaining, collecting, reviewing, updating, and providing logistics and sustainment documentation
Develop, modify, prepare, and/or validate documentation in relation to automated logistics or maintenance data reporting systems, and information systems
Participate in program reviews and working groups/events/activities to ensure all ILS requirements are met
Coordinate with various programs across the portfolio to ensure the DON Application Database Management System (DADMS) is updated and assist programs with making any required updates
Monitor and proactively alert the assistant program managers to software maintenance contracts and/or licenses that require renewal in a timely manner to not impact program schedule and sustainment requirements
Coordinate and monitor all acquisition logistics and sustainment functions as assigned
Participate in the evaluation of technical proposals and development of acquisition strategies for system acquisitions
Propose acquisition logistics thresholds, objectives, and Milestone Decision Review exit criteria
Participate in all system acquisition phases and Milestone Decision Reviews, as appropriate
Participate in the configuration management (CM) process to ensure ILS requirements are met
Coordinate with stakeholders and other responsible organizations to track the status of corrective actions
Identify, analyze, and provide mitigation strategies to eliminate program risks related to schedule and performance
Develop and update project briefs as required
Develop and submit bi-weekly and monthly status reports
Maintain current knowledge of relevant developments in area of expertise
Develop and deliver working level and senior leadership briefs
Provide general documentation support
Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
5 years' relevant experience with at least three (3) of these years in logistics management in DON programs
3+ years in Project Management or Project Support role
Ability to operate within a rapid-pace, dynamic environment, often-times managing multiple programs concurrently
Proficiency in Microsoft Project, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, and Excel
Excellent customer/client management skills and techniques – internal and external
Experience on an Acquisition Program
Preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Experience working in a program office on agile transformation projects
Knowledgeable in industry best practices, (e.g., Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL), Project Management Institute (PMI), and relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, PMI ACP, etc.)
Experience with acquisition related processes and deliverables (e.g., Statement of Work (SOW) and Data Item Descriptions (DIDs))
Strong data analysis skills with an ability to observe, receive, and otherwise obtain information from all relevant sources
Knowledgeable with Microsoft SharePoint.
Required Education, Certifications/ Licenses, Related Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Management, Business, Logistics Management, or related field
Physical Job Requirements
This position requires the ability to remain in a stationary position (standing and/or seated) more than half the time.
This position requires the ability to spend more than half the time viewing computer monitors.

This role is fully remote, we set a location because some job boards require it.

The Role

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to support our Procurement Team. As Logistics Analyst you will assist the Launch Operations team in onboarding and offboarding units in different apartment complexes and cities across the country (and eventually across the world!).

In this role, you will report to the LaunchOps Procurement Manager and work closely with the developing Procurement team. The logistical and procurement needs within this department are vast and of great urgency, and your role will help support its tremendous growth over the next three months. Your organization skills, attention to detail, and logistics knowledge will be used to help the department transition to new processes for launching new units, while also aiding in the task of re-allocating all the FF&E and OS&E inventory that we have in various markets due to move-outs.

About the Team

This role resides in our Launch Operations department, and falls within a newly-founded, centralized procurement team comprised of creative experts in design, supply chain logistics, and launch operations at Kasa, and all members work remotely across the U.S.

This team was founded by members of the Launch Operation department who were intent on increasing efficiency and scalability. We've launched some of the earliest Kasa properties, relying on grit, Costco, and local contractors. Since then, we have enlisted 3PL partners, reputable vendor relationships, and optimized procurement practices. We are looking for someone who welcomes change with open arms, and is a strong culture-add, bringing empathy, teamwork, and drive!

Day in the life of a Kasa Logistics Analyst
The Logistics Analyst (LA) will oversee all-things-supply chain: warehousing, inventory, installation, and procurement efforts for new builds and bulk ordering. This team looks to optimize inventory selection from our existing furniture inventory and minimize warehousing & shipping costs.
The LA will aid in managing the FF&E and OS&E inventory that we have in various markets due to move-outs from COVID. They will work with others on the team to input inventory into an inventory management software and aid Property Operations and Housekeeping with to optimize inventory usage and avoid out of stock situations.
The LA will manage the day-to-day relationship with the team's 3PL partner (or install teams), requesting project quotes, creating pick lists, managing inbound and outbound inventory and overseeing the installation. They will create standard operating procedures (SOPs), analysis, and seek cost-saving opportunities.
The LA will aid the Launch Operations Procurement Manager with any projects pertaining to logistics, inventory management, and procurement, including data entry.
The LA will oversee all move-outs to ensure that inventory is properly tracked and recorded, and they will ensure that the hard costs of storing and transporting the inventory remain at or below market, while maintaining quality.
The LA will work with both the Launch Operations Logistics Manager and the Interior Designer to ensure all units are handed over to our Property Operations and Guest Experience teams smoothly, setting up the rest of Kasa Ops for success
The LA will develop & continue to improve processes for inventory management, procurement, and onboarding/offboarding units.
Experience
2+ years of professional experience in Logistics, Procurement, Business Analytics, or a related field
Deep knowledge of logistics and production planning concepts; supply chain, warehousing, freight, inventory, and procurement is required
Strong analytical, interpersonal, and written/verbal communication skills coupled with the ability to work effectively as part of a team on multiple projects
Highly Organized; we're looking for a quick learner who is detail-oriented and hyper-organized while connecting with a variety of contractors, vendors, service providers, and other Ops teams within Kasa. You'll be juggling several different apps and resources to communicate and manage projects; organization is imperative
A track record of being reliable, delivering on time and on your promise. You take a proactive and decisive approach; all with pride in communicating well and staying organized
Plus if...
You enjoy technology and you're eager to learn new systems and platforms
You've worked for a startup or small business
You've worked in the hospitality industry at some point in your career
You're lighthearted and can handle stressful situations with a calm and positive demeanor
In one year, you will succeed at Kasa by having:
Set up 98% of FF&E items to be procured through bulk orders for standard tiered projects (excludes special projects).
Reduce design and procurement lead time required from 4 to 2 weeks by utilizing bulk orders, cost calculators, and order form sheets.
Assisted with a 5 - 10% cost reduction on inventory purchasing vs. H1 '21 baseline for standard move-in par levels.
Assisted in depleting all remaining FF&E and OS&E in storage locations due to move-outs.
Assisted the Property Operations and GX teams in Breezeway with their procurement needs.
Assisted in efforts to integrate an inventory management system.
Benefits
 Remote Work: With flexibility as a core value, and over three-quarters of the team working remotely, Kasa employees are able to work from anywhere!
✈ Kasa Travel Credit: We love to travel! Kasa employees get an allowance of free stays with us in any of our locations, plus a 50% discount on any nights for friends and family
 Generous Stock Option Plan: We believe the success of our business should be shared with our team. As you grow with us, we increase the opportunities for you to become part-owners of our company
 Flexible PTO: Full-time exempt Kasa employees are encouraged to take time off as they need and see fit, ensuring that it's not disruptive to their work
 Cell phone reimbursement: We reimburse a portion of your monthly cell phone bill to say thanks for using your personal phone during the workday
 401(k) plan: As you invest in yourself and your future, Kasa invests in you too: we match 50% of the first 4% of deferred salary
 Competitive Salary: We offer base salaries at or above market rates plus additional earning opportunities based on the position
 Health Coverage: We've invested in comprehensive health insurance options to help when you need it most
Who We Are

Kasa is building a global accommodations brand unlike any other. We took the best that hotels and short-term rentals had to offer and created a new class of hospitality that is well priced, trustworthy, and that offers a large selection of great locations. Our guests enjoy seamless check-ins, spacious apartments, and attractive amenities, helping them feel right at home. If anything comes up, our remote guest experience team is available 24/7, ensuring our hospitality is always felt, though rarely seen.

Behind the scenes, we build technology that combines with our innovative operations to grow a globally scalable offering that delivers high-quality stays. Our products and systems unlock unparalleled flexibility to operate anywhere from a few Kasa to a few hundred Kasas in any type of building, in just about any location. We currently have Kasas in over 17 states and are expanding into new markets all the time.

All of this is made possible by our team members, each of whom plays a critical role in fulfilling our vision and mission. We strive to foster a culture that values feedback, support, and collaboration throughout the organization. As a remote-first company, we work hard to bridge the gap of distance through initiatives that foster connection across Kasa. A few examples include lively All-Hands meetings, department get-togethers (online and in-person), and teamwide celebrations of important milestones. We offer benefits that encourage team members to stay at Kasa properties to experience our product firsthand and meet local team members when nearby. Guests are crucial to Kasa's mission. Accordingly, every new Kasa team member gets trained in our Guest Experience Akademy during their onboarding.

Our team is fortunate to have diverse backgrounds, personalities, and experiences united by a commitment to excellence and passion for our industry. If Kasa's vision and culture speak to you, and you're up for the challenge of building a company on the cutting edge of real estate, we would love to have you on our team!

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. You.


You bring your body, mind, heart and spirit to your work as a Sourcing Analyst.


You’re an analytical thinker with a service-oriented attitude.


You’re generous with your thoughts, your partnerships and especially your voice, because your opinion matters.


You’re great at what you do, but you want to be part of something even greater. Because you believe that while individuals can be strong, the right team is invincible.


Us.


System Services is our Corporate Headquarters in Broomfield, Colorado and is located within the Oracle campus. SCL Health is a faith-based, nonprofit healthcare organization dedicated to improving the well-being of the people we serve.


Benefits are one of the ways we encourage health for you and your family. Our generous package includes medical, dental and vision coverage. But health is more than a well-working body: it encompasses body, mind and social well-being. To that end, we’ve launched a Healthy Living program to address your holistic health. Healthy Living includes financial incentives, digital tools, tobacco cessation, classes, counseling and paid time off. We also offer financial wellness tools and retirement planning.


We.


Together we’ll align mission and careers, values and workplace. We’ll encourage joy and take pride in our integrity.


We’ll laugh at each other’s jokes (even the bad ones). We’ll hello and high five. We’ll celebrate milestones and acknowledge the value of spirituality in healing.


We’re proud of what we know, which includes how much there is to learn.


Your day.


As a Sourcing Analyst you need to know how to:



Prepare RFP and contract documents. Analyze vendor proposals and prepares summary for review by selection teams and Category Managers.

Incorporate appropriate terms and conditions into final contract documentation, ensuring adherence and compliance to all contractual, financial, Local and regulatory specifications or requirements.

Interface with GPO staff to evaluate GPO offerings. Analyzes their value and recommends which to use.

Administer all contacts related to clinical commodity agreements or purchased service agreements (as assigned).

Maintain current contract database to ensure the monitoring of expiration dates, payment schedules, and standardization opportunities.

Establish and maintain a filing system of agreements, contracts, bid specifications and related documents.

Accurately maintain and update information in the Item and Contract files.

Provide complex analysis regarding cost reduction opportunities across health system. Incorporate multiple variables and situational factors into analysis.

Prepare summaries and briefings on opportunities for decision makers and for high level administration.

Lead minor to moderately sized expense reduction initiatives with guidance of Category Managers and/or Supply Chain leadership.

Support Category Managers and value analysis teams through research and summarization of cost savings initiatives.

Review purchase history and patterns to identify opportunities for expense reduction via contract activities or product conversions.



Your experience.


We hire people, not resumes. But we also expect excellence, which is why we require:



Bachelor's Degree

Minimum of one (1) year of relevant experience



Preferred:



At least three (3) years of experience in contract information, negotiation and interpretation

At least three (3) years of experience in healthcare Material Management or purchasing



Your next move.


Now that you know more about this role and our team we hope you’ll join us. At SCL Health you’ll reaffirm every day how much you love this work, and why you were called to it in the first place.


Remote / Work from home position

Must be very versed in Excel it is an essential part of this position. This is a "domestic" logistics position. Good TMS knowledge.
Must be comfortable with overseeing a large amount of Data
Overview

The Logistics Analyst is responsible for freight analysis, carrier performance, system maintenance, and other various logistics tasks.
Primary Responsibilities

Process freight claims based on shipping discrepancies
Facilitate intercompany stock transfer order (STO) process
Analyze and provide recommendations on freight costs to support product margin price decisions
Research, identify and recommend lead time variability opportunities for improvement measures
Execute state to state product transfers
Monitor carrier performance based on scheduled pickup and delivery times
Ensure SAP parameters are set correctly and communicated to all carriers
Determine potential cost saving methods to pick up product from different vendors in same regions
Route import shipments effectively, optimizing container space
Communicate shipment exceptions to internal business stakeholders
Perform other related duties as assigned

Job Title: Finance Analyst, North America Amazon Logistics
Description:
BA/BS in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or a highly analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, and Computer Science)
3+ years of finance experience or a related analytical field

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. Operations is at the heart of what we do, delivering millions of packages each day and fulfilling customer orders from all over the world. Amazon is seeking a Financial Analyst to help lead and oversee critical functions for Amazon Logistics – our rapidly expanding internal delivery operation, purpose-built to achieve and exceed the delivery quality and speed demands of Amazon customers.
The Financial Analyst for North America Amazon Logistics will play a key role in disruptive new transportation initiatives, with a focus on business partnering, strategic decision support, financial controllership and cost reduction.

This individual will collaborate with multiple stakeholders to provide timely analysis, insightful guidance, and financial leadership to this high-growth organization.

This role requires extensive cross-functional partnership with various retail, transportation, and finance teams to identify best practices across the network and lead cost improvement efforts. Contributions include lead long term strategic planning, annual planning, variance analysis for monthly/quarterly business reviews, and ad-hoc projects and analysis as needed.

Key Responsibilities:

Proven ability to develop strategic relationships with your business partners – you influence the decisions. Demonstrated ability to root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues using data, then assist, consult with, and teach the business how decisions affect costs in their sites and create new mechanisms, as they are needed.
Expertise in collecting, analyzing and managing quantitative data and creating meaningful analyses to lead business improvement and cost reductions.
Recommend, develop, and implement policies and programs that guide the organization in maintaining and improving its competitive position and profitability.
Create a “learn by doing” environment by engaging with on-the-floor associates and managers to promote and encourage continued customer focus.
Partner with your team and develop weekly and monthly financial close activities, planning, forecasting, and reporting models while overseeing their continuous innovation and communication to both your operations & other business partners.
Ensure timely and accurate metrics and forecasts are created and maintained.
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results
Demonstrated ability to build and manage financial models for business forecasting, variance analysis, and problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work with business leaders to deliver results, including the ability to persuade with data.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, SQL and other analytical tools

The Role:
The Gigafactory Procurement team is looking to hire a skilled Global Supply Analyst to execute workplace development through sourcing strategies for the new Gigafactory located in Austin, TX. This person should have in-depth knowledge of workplace vendors and supplies and have experience negotiating contracts. A successful candidate will enjoy working in a fast paced, dynamic workplace.
Responsibilities:
Develop strong stakeholder support and cooperation on Workplace commodities ranging from culinary, janitorial, office supply and Workplace Experiences to material buyouts.
Pre-qualify and synthesize supplier, industry and market research for commodities to develop sourcing strategy.
Analyze current spends and evaluate current suppliers. Consolidate spends across supply base to create leverage, analyze purchasing trends and develop sourcing alternatives.
Drive continual cost reduction through ad hoc pricing negotiations, data collection, tracking and analysis of spend data for Workplace commodities.
Provide analysis of existing requirements and pricing to ensure the most cost-effective options in support of commodity business planning and savings.
Ensuring commodity spend is managed efficiently and effectively and within contract compliance.
Identify and negotiate commercial cost reduction opportunities. Develop solid understanding of cost drivers and contracts by commodity.
Issue RFx (RFQ, RFB, and RFP) for sourcing, ensuring all commercial terms are agreed and documented. Lead a strategic sourcing approval process.
Review, analyze and clarify quote packages from suppliers and service providers. Make and present recommendations to award.
Ensure NDA, SOWs and MSA are positioned appropriately before business is initiated.
Negotiate, evaluate and issue quarterly service PO’s.
Maintain day-to-day supplier relationships; act as the lead point of contact for all commercial issues, including but not limited to dispute resolution.
Support the purchase order closeout process including reconciliation of billings, changes, and payments.
Qualifications:
At least five (2) to (5) years’ experience in purchasing, preferably in the Workplace, Construction or Facilities space.
Additional experience in culinary, janitorial, and workspace management preferred.
MS or BS in Procurement and/or evidence of exceptional experience.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, Bluebeam and/or Acrobat.
Accounting experience is beneficial.
Blueprint reading helpful, but not a requirement.
Excellent analytical and judgment skills. Advanced excel skills a must have.
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
Strategic Sourcing, Opportunity Analyses, and Contract Negotiations.
Demonstrated ability to identify business process issues and drive process improvement.
Open-minded self-starter with the ability to adapt, improvise and problem solve.
Ability to work independently on multiple tasks and projects with various stakeholders.
Ability to prioritize and work in an extremely fast paced environment.
Organizational skills to manage and track transactional details.

Job Description
Everyone at Kite is grounded by one common goal – curing cancer. Every single day, we seek to establish a direct line between that purpose and our day-to-day work. Would you like to join us in this mission?
We are seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented contributor to join us as a Supply Chain Business Analyst for our custom Salesforce products. In this role, the Analyst will provide oversight into day to day production support while also guiding new enhancements from inception to implementation. Internally known as a Manager of Supply Chain, the Incumbent will report up to the Associate Director of Supply Chain, partnering closely with IT, Quality, Site Planning, and Validation teams. Working with their business customers in identifying system and data issues while partnering with IT to ensure these issues are resolved within agreed upon SLAs, the Analyst will also partner with their business customers in identifying new enhancements to their Salesforce systems, guiding these requests through a product development lifecycle. This includes request prioritization, gathering of detailed requirements and subsequent updating of existing specifications, authoring of test scripts and training materials, conducting user acceptance testing, updating of support documents, and overall adherence to Kite’s validation framework.
While our preference is for this position to be based out of our Frederick, Maryland facility, this opportunity can be a remotely-based position in the contiguous United States, with preference going to candidates who are centrally located or based on the East Coast.
The Supply Chain Business Analyst should expect 10-20% travel (both domestic and international) as determined by the business' needs.
Responsibilities of the Supply Chain Business Analyst include:
Known Subject Matter Expert for Site Planning and Quality systems built on the Salesforce platform
Proactively identify and report production issues (both system and data) related to Salesforce systems
Create Salesforce reports in order to identify data issues and verify successful data corrections
Train users on the use of Kite Salesforce systems and creation of Salesforce reports
Drill down into root cause of production issues along with proposed solutions (technical and process)
Present findings, options, and recommendations for proposed solutions to business users
Lead process re-engineering workshops with business and IT stakeholders
Document process steps and system enhancements required to support process
Oversee approval for user access requests to Salesforce products
Support development of business cases for new system capabilities
Work alongside business groups to capture requirements and their priorities
Support creation and management of change requests
Perform impact assessment on new or changing product capabilities, including impact to integrated (boundary) systems
Author system related documents including requirement specifications, process flow diagrams, test scripts, work instructions, SOPs, and various assessments per Kite Validation procedures
Support future Salesforce custom application implementations and migrations
Coordinate the testing of changes and enhancements with the business to ensure successful delivery
Basic Qualifications:
MA / MS degree with 5+ years of Supply Chain and/or Business Information Systems and/or cGMP manufacturing domain experience
OR
BS / BA degree with 7+ years of the aforementioned experience
OR
High School degree with 11+ years of the aforementioned experience
Preferred Qualifications:
6+ years of experience in an operations role in the life sciences and/or medical devices industry
Strong understanding of E2E logistics, Manufacturing, Quality, and related system processes (PTD)
Knowledge of the Salesforce Lightning Platform solution
Experience building reports in Salesforce Lightning
Experience in ERP systems including implementation and SDLC, ideally GxP experience in biopharmaceutical environment - SAP preferred
Experience in Project Management, preferably with Agile Methodology or Scrum Framework
Proven ability in authoring technical documents and business processes
Collaborative meeting skills and ability to work in a virtual work environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to facilitate meetings
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and responsibility for meeting deliverables

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

As a Procurement Operations Analyst for the Amazon Fulfillment Center team, you will own the site’s indirect procurement operation responsibilities, including forecasting, inventory management, purchase order management and Vendor management of 3rd party service providers. You will lead supplier management KPI and metrics reporting, and work with stakeholders to find and understand deviation and improvement areas. You will provide procurement leadership and align with the building leadership team to drive efficiencies and improvements at the site(s).

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

In partnership with the Procurement Operations Manager, provide procurement operations support for the fulfillment center, including: forecasting of non-inventory products, inventory management, non-inventory flow and space models, cycle counts, supplier management, procurement transaction and expediting support
Lead team of non-inventory receivers to ensure building has adequate resources and is set up for success
Develop deep knowledge of non-inventory items and align with like buildings to drive best practices
Manage KPI to measure, control and benchmark procurement processes including creation of recurring metrics reports to drive improvements for the Operations network
Develop relationship across the building and network to ensure best practices are being shared and implemented
Align with internal customers, Finance and Procurement Operations to understand budgetary targets by building and develop methods of measuring and defining savings, value and other category metrics
Using input from the category team, build the category metrics model to track and monitor performance in relationship to the category strategy
Measure actual vs planned savings; as savings trends are identified, own action plans to meet goals and develop solutions
Work in partnership both internally and with suppliers to develop innovative solutions to provide Procurement support to the Operations network
Develop and implement ways to measure suppliers to drive continuous performance improvement on behalf of Amazon
Coordinate the demand identification, procurement, and inventory management of all non-merchandise items required for building operation. This includes corrugate, packing materials, labor and janitorial services, etc.
Partner with Category team to manage and maintain supplier scorecards

. Partner with AP, Suppliers and various internal teams to ensure timely resolution of vendor payment issues

Support the procurement operations and category management teams
Work is done in a warehouse environment that requires frequent walking around the building. You should feel comfortable working in an environment with varying temperatures as many buildings have dock doors that open throughout shifts.
Procurement experience preferred
Experience in Coupa or other financial management/procurement software
Experience with cost accounting
Lean / Six-Sigma knowledge
Must be highly self-motivated and customer-centric
Ability to work with ambiguity
Provide a positive customer experience internally and externally

Jacobs is seeking a highly motivated and dedicated Sr. Life Cycle Logistics Analyst for the upcoming PEO Solider contract located at Fort Belvoir, Virginia.
PEO Soldier supports Soldiers by developing, integrating, acquiring, fielding, and sustaining products to provide significant improvements in battle command, situational awareness, survivability, and mobility of Soldiers. By viewing the Soldier as part of an integrated system, PEO Soldier ensures that the Soldier and everything he or she wears or carries works together as an integrated system. The result is an overall systematic design that benefits Soldiers by enhancing their ability to accomplish individual and collective tasks, improving quality of life, building confidence, and saving lives. PEO Soldier designs, develops, procures, fields, and sustains virtually everything the Soldier wears or carries.
This position is CONTINGENT upon contract award. The award date is expected in January 2022. Our recruiting team will follow up with you on your application and will begin the interview evaluation process immediately.
Job Description:
The Life Cycle Logistics Analyst provides senior-level logistics expertise. Integrates and plans for the 12 Integrated Product Support Elements (IPSE) in all phases of the sustainment and acquisition processes. Interfaces with ASAALT, AMC, LCMC, PEO Soldier, ATEC, AEC, CASCOM, MCOE, and other PEOs and PM on logistics requirements.
Establishes and assists in the planning, developing, coordinating, defending and executing all aspects of the PEO/PMs’ Life Cycle Logistics support under the processes of DoD acquisition and sustainment.
Produces acquisition logistics documentation in support of the PEO/PMs products.
Performs and develops plans and projects, determines needs, investigates and resolves problems, interfaces with other functions and stakeholders prepares capital assets and operating requests, and manages functional areas.
Assists in logistics automation using enterprise planning tools (GCSS-Army, DPAS, LMP, and etc.) for acquisition and sustainment operations
Directs the activities of a group of applicable stakeholders in order to conduct focused strategic planning and analysis for all life-cycle management functions.
Provides AirDrop Liaison support IAW with PWS 3.4.14
Here’s What You’ll Need:
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree and greater than 10 years of relevant experience.
Thorough understanding of Life Cycle Logistics regulations and policies including DoD 5000 series, AR 70-1, AR 700-127, and AR 700-142.
Competency in communication, leadership, logistics automated systems, team management, and risk management.

Secret

May include, but are not limited to, the following:
Arrange for truckload/bulk carrier services by specific routing requirements.
Provide freight analysis and support systems for truckload/bulk shipments
Develop, format, and publish monthly key performance metrics related to customer requirements
Develop relationships with corporate partners and field operations to understand needs, develop solutions and support execution of those solutions.
Audit vendor and agent invoices for accuracy and contract compliance; review and approve transportation invoices for payment
Resolve service issues and help implement processes for continual improvement
Assist with filing of carrier claims and incident reports.
Compile and maintain current, potential, and past vendor records.
Identify transportation related service and/or cost improvements through industry research.
Other duties as assigned
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, Transportation, or related field or equivalent combination of education and transportation industry experience. Have a minimum of 3 years relevant experience in dispatching, freight management/brokerage, warehousing, or process development.
Or High School Diploma with 5 years relevant experience in dispatching, freight management/brokerage, warehousing, or process development.
Strong written and oral communication skills required
Intermediate experience with Excel required
Proficiency with computers including Microsoft Word, Outlook and PowerPoint required
Consistently demonstrates proven ability to learn and use necessary tools
Ability to follow process and standard procedures required
ERP and transportation management system knowledge and usage highly desirable; SAP a plus
Strong skills in routing software
Strong analytical and problem solving skills to identify the root cause and articulate associated action plans
Strong decision making and presentation skills
Be results driven, self-motivator and proven ability to continuously improve processes and annual metrics
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; stand; walk; use hands to touch, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate as normally based in an office. Some of the work may be required in the operating units which can require usage of required PPE including safety glasses, hearing protection, etc. May also result in exposure to outside elements and may require usage of stairs and elevators. Travel including air travel or auto travel may occasionally be required.

Supply Chain AnalystNO SPONSORSHIP AT THIS TIME: A Toyota Industries Corporation Group affiliateMalin celebrates 50 years as the leader in intralogistics solutions by way of lean, consultative approaches, material handling equipment application and systems integration. Our customer partners: some of the largest and most revered in their industry. Our presence spans across 7 offices in Texas and Louisiana as a Raymond company, part of the Toyota industries family.Our Systems & Automation Department provides sales, engineering, estimating and project management support to quote and install materials handling systems. Our Service Department provides local maintenance support along with national support from the Raymond network of dealers.Job Description: Collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data using querying skills, statistical knowledge, and business intuition, advanced analytical ability, and data transformation techniques to transform raw data into useful information.The individual will drive better, and faster decision making for our sales and engineering teams. You will identify actionable insights for our clients while working concurrently with the sales and engineering teams to make strategic recommendations. You will work with cross-functional departments and teams to support project goals and outcomes. Excellent verbal and written skills are necessary to communicate and present to our clients. Excellent professional conduct and high level of business ethics is expected. Understanding the movement of goods thru the Supply Chain is preferred but not required.Job Responsibilities: · Designs information systems and/or utilizes existing systems to extract, review, analyze and interpret complex data and make appropriate recommendations to sales, engineering, and clients.· Independently identifies and learns applicable new techniques as needed· Queries databases and applies advanced data manipulation techniques across multiple sources.· Integrates data from multiple data sets into one database system to streamline information to build a business case for material handling solutions.· Design reports to show statistics and other information about specific databasetopics· Isolate and resolve issues with data and databases with clients· Create and/or propose solutions to sales, engineering, and clients· Tools: SSMS (SQL Server Management Studio) or similar tool. (SSMS is a +), SQLite is another tool· Know how to use T-SQL.· Know about optimizing code.· Know how to execute functions and procedures.· Team player, good listening, and presentation skills· Continuous improvement mentality looking for ideas to standardize the data environment and minimize complexity.Basic Requirements: Continued meeting or exceeding of department performance goalsProficient with Microsoft ExcelMalin a Raymond Company is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual OrientationJob Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offReferral programVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location: Multiple Locations

Facebook is seeking an experienced Field Logistics Analyst to focus on Data Center Field and Warehouse operations. This person will be responsible for supporting the regional field leads to develop and implement consistent processes. This position requires communication skills, collaboration, a natural orientation to process analysis and optimization, the understanding of logistics processes and systems, and experience with data analysis and project management.


Develop, refine, and maintain documentation that captures and distributes the processes and policies for executing safe, effective logistics operations in Facebook data centers
Identify gaps in operations and present solutions to standardize operations across the data center regions
Build and support cross-functional relationships with internal partners drive effective communication channels supporting operations management
Help produce monthly audit of compliance to ensure meeting all inventory controls
Support month/quarter and year end requirement to ensure appropriate financial reporting
Enable and support leaders to understand business requirements, implement new processes and contribute to ongoing process improvements
Drive inventory reconciliation process to identify risk, manage obsolescence, and correct errors impacting product movement
Support improving operational and system gaps from the various warehouse and vendor entities to meet all compliance requirements
Raise the visibility of field issues that require better systemic controls to central logistics for the development of improved processes
Work with field leads, vendors and contract labor to develop and execute action plans in the implementation of these new processes
Develop a dynamic logistics operations assessment program to ensure consistent implementation and sustainment of processes across all field entities
Generate metrics highlighting performance and trends within the data center field and warehouse operations
Support the execution of Sarbanes-Oxley requirements, analyze discrepancies and help working teams develop root cause corrective actions and trend improvements
Help define and manage ongoing KPI’s to measure process compliance and logistics operations performance
Partner in developing shared solutions when inconsistencies are identified
10% travel required


Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, operations management, business management and/or any other business-related field, or equivalent work experience
Knowledge in as-is/to-be business process mapping, gap analysis, requirements elicitation and data analysis
Experience working independently, prioritizing, and managing one's time
Experience with ERP, TMS, CMS, WMS systems – Oracle, Excel or any other analytics tools
Communication, problem solving, and interpersonal experience


Experience in a data center environment
Experience in business analysis/program management
Experience handling project management responsibilities (prioritization, planning, scheduling, status reporting)
Experience in cross-functional projects across multiple teams
Knowledge in Supply Chain process from Procure-to-Pay
Knowledge with Supply Chain and Inventory management models


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Duties
WHAT IS THE PROCUREMTN DIVISION?
A description of the business units can be found at: https://www.jobs.irs.gov/about/who/business-divisions

Vacancies will be filled in the following specialty areas:
Office of The Chief Procurement Officer

The following are the duties of this position at the full working level. If you are selected at a lower grade level, you will have the opportunity to learn to perform these duties and will receive training to help you grow in this position.

Conducts detailed reviews of complex and high value procurement actions to ensure compliance with federal acquisition regulations, internal operating policies and procedures, and to influence new and/or revised procedures that improve OCPO operational efficiencies.
Collaborates and guides stakeholders through the process and execution of Assignment of Claims, Novation Agreements, Protests, and Terminations to determine and ensure compliance with the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), Department of the Treasury Acquisition Regulation (DTAR), Department of the Treasury Acquisition Procedures (DTAP), and Internal Revenue Service Acquisition Policy (IRSAP) supplemental regulations.
Serves as an Office Director's representative on cross-functional task forces or committees. Serves as Lead Coordinator for Treasury Inspector General Tax Administration (TIGTA) audits, General Accounting Office (GAO) audits, Office of Chief Financial Officer (CFO)/ Internal Controls Reviews, and other IRS stakeholder data request.
Contributes to the development, review, and updating of the formulation of the Procurement Director's short- range and long-range Strategic Business Plan and Annual Quality Plan.
Serves as an advisor to Procurement and Services on acquisitions of complex supplies and services, which have a significant impact on the effectiveness, and timeliness of the entire tax system nationwide.

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
As required by Executive Order 14043, Federal employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee's duty location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected, you will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination by November 22, 2021 or before appointment or onboarding, if after November 22. We will provide additional information regarding what information or documentation will be needed and how you can request a legally required exception from this requirement.
If you are in a telework eligible position, you may be directed to temporarily telework on a full-time basis due to COVID 19. Employees must be within a 200-mile radius of their official assigned post-of-duty (POD) while in a telework status. Once normal operations resume, employees may be directed back to the office to perform the duties of their position. Telework eligibility does not guarantee telework; employees must meet and sustain IRS telework eligibility requirements and supervisor's approval to participate in the IRS Telework Program. As a reminder - If you are selected for a position, you are responsible for reporting to your designated POD (location) on the negotiated start date or as directed by management.
Must be a U.S. Citizen or National and provide proof of U.S. Citizenship. (Birth certificate showing birth in the U.S; Unexpired U.S. Passport; Certificate of Citizenship or Naturalization; or Report of Birth Abroad of a U.S. Citizen (Form FS-240))
Subject to a 1-year probationary period (unless already completed).
Have your salary sent to a financial institution of your choice by Direct Deposit/Electronic Funds Transfer.
Undergo an income tax verification and review of prior performance/conduct.
Must successfully complete a background investigation, including a FBI criminal history record check (fingerprint check).
Complete a Declaration for Federal Employment to determine your suitability for Federal employment, at the time requested by the agency.
If you are a male applicant born after December 31, 1959, certify that you have registered with the Selective Service System or are exempt from having to do so.

Qualifications
Federal experience is not required. The experience may have been gained in the public sector, private sector or Volunteer Service. One year of experience refers to full-time work; part-timework is considered on a prorated basis. To ensure full credit for your work experience, please indicate dates of employment by month/year, and indicate number of hours worked per week, on your resume.

You must meet the following requirements by the closing date of this announcement:

BASIC REQUIREMENT: To be eligible for this position at this grade level, you must meet the requirements below: You must have completed all Mandatory Training requirements as described in Department of Treasury Acquisition Career Management Program Handbook

AND have 4 years of experience in contracting or related positions and 1 year of that experience must have been specialized experience at or equivalent to the next lower level as defined below.
AND a 4-year course of study leading to a bachelor's degree, that included or was supplemented by at least 24 semester hours in any combination of the following fields: accounting, business, finance, law contracts, purchasing, economics, industrial management, marketing, quantitative methods, or organization and management.
OR Exception: Employees occupying a GS-1102 position will be considered to have met the standard for positions they occupy on or after January 1, 2000. However, basic requirements and specialized experience requirements must be met in order to qualify for promotion to a higher grade unless granted a waiver.

In addition to meeting the basic requirement above, to qualify for this position you must also meet the qualification requirements listed below:

SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-13 level in the Federal Service. Examples of specialized experience includes: You must have the following Specialized Experience for this position: Demonstrate In-depth and extensive knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), contracting laws and policies including techniques of contracting operations, detailed procedures of department contracting requirements, and familiarity with the practices of business and industry to develop policies and provide guidance to subordinate activities. Experience using procurement principles and techniques or program requirements to plan, make decisions, and/or make recommendations that significantly affect the content, interpretation, or development of long-range, or interrelated agency policies and programs concerning the management of procurement issues. Experience providing expert technical guidance and consultation on the procurement function including responsibility for formulating guidelines, implementing new developments, and providing policy interpretation to subordinate contracting activities. Experience in negotiation techniques, cost/price analysis, legal and regulatory interpretations, unique terms and conditions, subcontracting requirements and complex technical specifications. Experience evaluating procurement activities, regulations, and other relevant material as a basis for developing and implementing guides or procedures. Your experience must also demonstrate skills in oral and written communications to present sensitive recommendations to senior level managers and executives; to obtain compliance with policies from subordinate activities; to serve as a representative on cross-functional task forces, committees or to the private sector; and to develop and implement internal management documents and correspondence pertaining to acquisition procedures.

For more information on qualifications please refer to OPM's Qualifications Standards.
Education
For positions with an education requirement, or if you are qualifying for this position by substituting education or training for experience, submit a copy of your transcripts or equivalent. An official transcript will be required if you are selected.

Note: If substituting Superior Academic Achievement (SAA) for experience at the GS-7 level, please note that grade-point averages are rounded to one decimal place. For example, 2.95 will round to 3.0 and 2.94 will round to 2.9. The Qualifications requirements above will reflect if SAA is accepted for this position and the online questionnaire will offer the option to select SAA as a qualifying response.


A college or university degree generally must be from an accredited (or pre-accredited) college or university recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. For a list of schools which meet these criteria, please refer to Department of Education Accreditation page.

FOREIGN EDUCATION: Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. You must show proof the education credentials have been deemed to be at least equivalent to that gained in conventional U.S. education program. It is your responsibility to provide such evidence when applying. Click here for Foreign Education Credentialing instructions.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
Your application includes your resume, responses to the online questions, and required supporting documents. Please be sure that your resume includes detailed information to support your qualifications for this position; failure to provide sufficient evidence in your resume may result in a "not qualified" determination.

Rating: You will be assessed on the following competencies (knowledge, skills, abilities, and other characteristics):
Contracting/Procurement
Customer Service
Oral Communication
Planning and Evaluating
Problem Solving

Category rating will be used to rank and select eligible candidates. If qualified, you will be assigned to one of two quality level categories, CAT A/B, CAT C depending on your responses to the online questions, regarding your experience, education, and training related to this position. Your rating may be lowered if your responses to the online questions are not supported by the education and/or experience described in your application.

Referral: If you are among the top qualified candidates, your application may be referred to a selecting official for consideration. Candidates, if required to participate in a selection interview (telephonic and/or in person at the discretion of the Selecting Official in accordance with hiring practices), will be interviewed in quality group order. We will not reimburse costs related to the interview such as travel to and from the interview site.

Veterans' preference is applied after applicants are assessed. Preference-eligibles will be listed at the top of their assigned quality group and considered before non-preference-eligibles in that quality group. Qualified preference-eligibles with a compensable service-connected disability of 10% or more will be listed at the top of the highest quality group for this position. For scientific and professional positions Qualified preference-eligibles with a compensable service-connected disability of 10% or more will be listed at the top of the highest category for this position, except at the GS-09 and above.

If you are a displaced or surplus Federal employee (eligible for the Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP)/Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP), you must receive a rating of category CATA/B to be rated as "well qualified" to receive special selection priority.
