Job Title: Fully-remote Infor Application Analyst - Supply Chain
Description:
Overview: To be part of our organization, every employee should understand and share in the YNHHS Vision, support our Mission, and live our Values. These values - integrity, patient-centered, respect, accountability, and compassion - must guide what we do, as individuals and professionals, every day.

Functions as the primary contact and expert for the application. Working under general direction, builds, installs and supports applications. Coordinates all issues that arise during the project . Primary responsibilities include : analyzing work flows and understanding policies, procedures and constraints of the business operations. In depth and precise investigation and documentation of operational specifications and application functionality is required. Work with users to determine project needs, develop proposals, and recommend opportunities for technological and work flow improvement. Function as the primary contact to support the implementation of new projects and upgrades as well as troubleshoot problems and questions from end ?users during training, go-live and post go-live periods. Attention to detail is a critical skill for this position. Successful candidates have an interest in emerging technologies and enjoy working with people to identify how technology can effectively support business needs.

EEO/AA/Disability/Veteran Responsibilities:
1. Application Implementation and Support
1.1 Supports application implementation and maintenance including analysis, planning and preparation.
2. Teamwork
2.1 Creates and maintains regular status reports to Manager.
3. Documentation
3.1 Documents and maintains all required system design and build documents and configures system accordingly
4. Other
4.1 Provides training to other IT staff and user clients as appropriate.
5. Infor Responsibilities
5.1 Directly responsible for designing, programming, testing, installing, and maintaining all necessary data conversions, interfaces, process flows, reports, and/or enhancements to the Infor system.
6. This position may require the following responsibilities:
6.1 Develop and maintain corporate-wide information standards, policies and procedures. Reports status on a regular basis to management and user communities.
Qualifications:

EDUCATION
Bachelors degree in related field preferred.
EXPERIENCE
Minimum 5 years experience in Healthcare and/or technology strongly preferred. Healthcare and/or Infor experience preferred.
LICENSURE
Infor Certification: Certification in the applicable Infor module is required.
SPECIAL SKILLS
Ability to analyze workflow to recommend and develop application solutions. Ability to research and interpret data ; to include reporting, preparing and presenting data. Ability to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision and ability to deal with simultaneous tasks, communicate effectively, problem solve, and develop creative solutions to complex problems required. Strong organizational. problem solving and listening skills, attention to detail, innovative thinking and ability to inspire others required. Must possess a high level of customer service skills and participate as strong, collaborative team player. Capable of taking leadership role in managing end user relationships. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools required.
PHYSICAL DEMAND
Travel to multiple YNHHS facilities is necessary.

Company Name: Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company
Description:
Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility
At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.

We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.
We are currently seeking a Logistics Analyst. This position requires a dynamic individual with a strong analytical background who will be responsible for analyzing data for the Logistics group.
Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.
You Will:
Interpret data on logistics elements, such as availability, maintainability, reliability, supply chain management, strategic sourcing or distribution, supplier management, or transportation.
Provide ongoing analyses in areas such as transportation costs, parts procurement, back orders, or delivery processes
Prepare reports on logistics performance measures
Confer with logistics management teams to determine ways to optimize service levels, maintain supply-chain efficiency, or minimize cost
Maintain databases of logistics information
Collate data from across the business
Ensure reliability, integrity and accuracy of data
Undertake detailed and thorough logistics analysis and identify opportunities to aid efficiency and cost optimization through evaluation of data
Ensure analysis is in line with business goals and targets
Create statistical and financial models and use appropriate software to review opportunities for cost savings and efficiencies in the logistics process, such as inventory levels, budget or transportation schedules
Make recommendations based on findings and analysis
Produce forecasts and estimates to aid financially sound decisions and cash flow planning
Ensure logistics costs are monitored, managed and under control
Collaborate with manager or stakeholders to determine effective solutions
Participate in regular planning reviews and change processes and prepare data in line with changes
Set up and provide regular reports and data relating to specific areas of the logistics process such as supplier analysis, transportation costs
Track logistics trends and use information to recommend changes
Utilize knowledge and research methods to benchmark logistics activities and to drive best practice results
Work with Logistics and other appropriate staff to resolve issues as and when required
Provide additional analytical support as required
Report against key performance indicators
Work towards and support a culture of continuous improvement and work to make business and department improvements wherever possible
You Bring:
5+ years of experience in any of the following areas: material flow, warehouse design, transportation management, dedicated fleet operations, distribution center management, materials handling, decision support systems and technology
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with success in working across organizations at all levels.
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects, effective project planning in terms of resources, strategies, cost, and time with ability to meet project timelines.
Experience with Materials requirements planning logistics and supply chain software, Enterprise resource planning ERP software, Analytical or scientific software, or Enterprise resource planning ERP software
Strong computer proficiency in MS Office applications
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred in Supply Chain, Logistics Engineering, Finance, Engineering or related field. An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience may be considered
LEAN, GK, or Six Sigma Certifications a plus

Facebook is seeking an experienced Field Logistics Analyst to focus on Data Center Field and Warehouse operations. This person will be responsible for supporting the regional field leads to develop and implement consistent processes. This position requires communication skills, collaboration, a natural orientation to process analysis and optimization, the understanding of logistics processes and systems, and experience with data analysis and project management.


Develop, refine, and maintain documentation that captures and distributes the processes and policies for executing safe, effective logistics operations in Facebook data centers
Identify gaps in operations and present solutions to standardize operations across the data center regions
Build and support cross-functional relationships with internal partners drive effective communication channels supporting operations management
Help produce monthly audit of compliance to ensure meeting all inventory controls
Support month/quarter and year end requirement to ensure appropriate financial reporting
Enable and support leaders to understand business requirements, implement new processes and contribute to ongoing process improvements
Drive inventory reconciliation process to identify risk, manage obsolescence, and correct errors impacting product movement
Support improving operational and system gaps from the various warehouse and vendor entities to meet all compliance requirements
Raise the visibility of field issues that require better systemic controls to central logistics for the development of improved processes
Work with field leads, vendors and contract labor to develop and execute action plans in the implementation of these new processes
Develop a dynamic logistics operations assessment program to ensure consistent implementation and sustainment of processes across all field entities
Generate metrics highlighting performance and trends within the data center field and warehouse operations
Support the execution of Sarbanes-Oxley requirements, analyze discrepancies and help working teams develop root cause corrective actions and trend improvements
Help define and manage ongoing KPI’s to measure process compliance and logistics operations performance
Partner in developing shared solutions when inconsistencies are identified
10% travel required


Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, operations management, business management and/or any other business-related field, or equivalent work experience
Knowledge in as-is/to-be business process mapping, gap analysis, requirements elicitation and data analysis
Experience working independently, prioritizing, and managing one's time
Experience with ERP, TMS, CMS, WMS systems – Oracle, Excel or any other analytics tools
Communication, problem solving, and interpersonal experience


Experience in a data center environment
Experience in business analysis/program management
Experience handling project management responsibilities (prioritization, planning, scheduling, status reporting)
Experience in cross-functional projects across multiple teams
Knowledge in Supply Chain process from Procure-to-Pay
Knowledge with Supply Chain and Inventory management models


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide — making the impossible happen every single day.
The Logistics Product Flow Analyst will oversee, but not be limited to, the flow of product to the customer. This person will work closely with the Delivery Excellence as an escalation point regarding PO risks, appointment needs, and delivery prioritization. The Direct Ship Manager will be able to prioritize shipments and communicate with a sense of urgency. This person will be customer focused and able to communicate what the root cause of an opportunity is, while providing a solution.
This person can work professionally with cross-functional partners both internally and externally while having a positive attitude.
Key Responsibilities:
Prioritize deliveries to customer based on need dates (while partnering with Delivery Excellence)
Partner with Delivery Excellence as an escalation point for product dwelling
Identify opportunities for continuous performance improvement and optimization
Handle the flow of product by customer through the Supply Chain
Provide flow guidance and expertise to inform new Transportation initiatives
Handle customer appointments, diverts and cancels
PO risks, appointment needs and dwelling

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain, or related discipline
2+ years of transportation and/or supply chain experience
Experience with root cause analysis
Travel, 5-10%
Preferred:
Master’s degree in related discipline

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Summary
Posted: Nov 5, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200309162
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it. At Apple, we make extraordinary products that empower people to improve their health. The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourage the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Apple’s operations teams ensure that Apple’s ground-breaking designs become industry-leading products, delivered in a timely manner to Apple’s unmatched quality standards. These high-profile, highly respected organizations are positioned at the junction of Apple’s product teams, the industries that supply core component technologies, and our manufacturing partners who help ensure that revolutionary products such as iPad, iPhone, and Mac can be restocked just as fast as they fly off the shelves. We’re looking for high-energy people to support the procurement, manufacturing, fulfillment, and support of all things Apple. The Worldwide Logistics Procurement Team is looking for a Freight Audit Analyst to work from Austin. This role will be reporting to the Freight Audit Manager. If you’re interested in being a part of a team that’s constantly learning and problem-solving, we’d love to talk with you. Outstanding operational perfection is a cornerstone of Apple's ability to consistently surprise and delight our customers. This is a fast moving, dynamic environment where flexibility and adaptability are key attributes needed for success.
Key Qualifications
Problem solving mindset in which you can work collaboratively with different functions to develop creative solutions and drive those solutions through implementation
Ability to work diligently and thoroughly through a process to ensure the desired outcomes are achieved
Analytical background with an ability to process complex data sets
Should be versed in advanced MS excel tactics
Ability to work autonomously
Strong work ethic with a high degree of flexibility
Description
Typical responsibilities will include but not be limited to: - Working with business customers across Apple and the freight forwarders ensuring end-to-end freight invoices are audited and paid correctly. - Implementing efficient finance processes to streamline the billing and tracking of the service costs to Apple’s customers and provide efficient billing processes for Apple’s suppliers - Responsible for Apple freight audit Suppliers’ key performance indicators for operations to deliver and exceed customer expectations - Tracking, monitoring and reporting of invoice exceptions to ensure 100% compliance with targets As a Freight Audit Analyst, you will be part of a global team responsible for the end-2-end management of Apple’s freight invoice auditing and payment as well as using the data to impact Apple’s supply chain decisions. Some of the team’s responsibilities include validating and reconciling invoices, compiling freight audit reports, preforming data analysis about Apples logistics network and sharing it with regional logistics teams, and building new processes to optimize our work. In this role you will work cross functionally with carriers, service providers, Apple finance, logistics, and supply chain teams.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
Additional Requirements

Mauser Packaging Solutions is a global leader in solutions and services across the packaging lifecycle, providing large and small metal, plastic, fiber and hybrid packaging worldwide to companies in industries from food, beverage, personal care and pharmaceuticals to chemicals, petrochemicals, agrochemicals and paints. Bringing together the very best of its four legacy companies— BWAY, MAUSER Group, NCG and ICS—Mauser Packaging Solutions offers its customers true sustainability at scale.
Position Summary:
The corporate logistics analyst role will be responsible for the collection, review and analysis of logistics data to assist in maximizing supply chain efficiency at MPS. The role will develop logistics lane analysis, provide transportation conversion solutions, and assist in the implementation and reporting of freight performance across the supply chain.. The ideal candidate will have good analytical skills and preferably have some experience in supply chain, logistics, and data analytics.
Responsibilities:
Drive supply chain cost improvement and performance of logistics through data analysis of relevant freight and vendor data
Provide creative and insightful lane recommendations and options to stakeholders based on data analysis and route optimization output
Operate databases within logistics management and Utilize transportation optimization software
Model lane solutions supporting net freight income targets and service level improvements for the inbound supply chain
Utilize financial, logistical and procurement databases/systems to assist in for the development, analysis and modeling for load related supply chain efficiency improvements
Communicate with field or other internal / external stakeholders
Develop accurate KPI’s to track proper metrics to measure supply chain performance
Create, run and develop decks (PowerPoints) to be used for weekly/monthly meetings
#LI-FC1

Requirements:
3 years’ experience of analytical support (non-manager), preferably in the supply chain industry
Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain or related field
Excellent analytical and financial skills
Excellent Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
Experience in PowerBI, Tableau or other visualization tools
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Works well with all organizational levels
Able to work effectively in a multi-tasking environment
Able to work constructively under stress and pressure
Able to exhibit a high degree of professionalism
Able to work with and interact effectively with all levels of management

The Role:
The Gigafactory Procurement team is looking to hire a skilled Global Supply Analyst to execute workplace development through sourcing strategies for the new Gigafactory located in Austin, TX. This person should have in-depth knowledge of workplace vendors and supplies and have experience negotiating contracts. A successful candidate will enjoy working in a fast paced, dynamic workplace.
Responsibilities:
Develop strong stakeholder support and cooperation on Workplace commodities ranging from culinary, janitorial, office supply and Workplace Experiences to material buyouts.
Pre-qualify and synthesize supplier, industry and market research for commodities to develop sourcing strategy.
Analyze current spends and evaluate current suppliers. Consolidate spends across supply base to create leverage, analyze purchasing trends and develop sourcing alternatives.
Drive continual cost reduction through ad hoc pricing negotiations, data collection, tracking and analysis of spend data for Workplace commodities.
Provide analysis of existing requirements and pricing to ensure the most cost-effective options in support of commodity business planning and savings.
Ensuring commodity spend is managed efficiently and effectively and within contract compliance.
Identify and negotiate commercial cost reduction opportunities. Develop solid understanding of cost drivers and contracts by commodity.
Issue RFx (RFQ, RFB, and RFP) for sourcing, ensuring all commercial terms are agreed and documented. Lead a strategic sourcing approval process.
Review, analyze and clarify quote packages from suppliers and service providers. Make and present recommendations to award.
Ensure NDA, SOWs and MSA are positioned appropriately before business is initiated.
Negotiate, evaluate and issue quarterly service PO’s.
Maintain day-to-day supplier relationships; act as the lead point of contact for all commercial issues, including but not limited to dispute resolution.
Support the purchase order closeout process including reconciliation of billings, changes, and payments.
Qualifications:
At least five (2) to (5) years’ experience in purchasing, preferably in the Workplace, Construction or Facilities space.
Additional experience in culinary, janitorial, and workspace management preferred.
MS or BS in Procurement and/or evidence of exceptional experience.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, Bluebeam and/or Acrobat.
Accounting experience is beneficial.
Blueprint reading helpful, but not a requirement.
Excellent analytical and judgment skills. Advanced excel skills a must have.
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
Strategic Sourcing, Opportunity Analyses, and Contract Negotiations.
Demonstrated ability to identify business process issues and drive process improvement.
Open-minded self-starter with the ability to adapt, improvise and problem solve.
Ability to work independently on multiple tasks and projects with various stakeholders.
Ability to prioritize and work in an extremely fast paced environment.
Organizational skills to manage and track transactional details.

OptumRx, a UnitedHealth Group company, with over 28,000 employees globally, specializes in the delivery, clinical management and affordability of prescription medications and consumer health products. Our goal is to deliver high-quality, integrated services to promote optimal outcomes, superior savings and outstanding client and consumer experiences. We make healthier happen by creating smarter health care connections to help more than 65 million consumers nationwide realize improved care, lower costs and a better overall experience. This is a place like no other and where you’ll do your life’s best work.(sm)
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Mines data from various sources to pull together a holistic view of the carrier network and carrier network performance
Analyzes performance across all services, lanes and carriers in order to make recommendations that improve service levels, protect the member experience, considers shipping costs and reduces resends
Partners with Logistics team, carriers and other internal partners to execute against recommendations
Works with the site to coordinate the carrier and/or service moves
Works with Managers to track costs and impacts of moves on resends, member calls, Net Promoter Score (NPS), etc.
Recommends and manages the addition of couriers, regional carriers, consolidators and how/where each are used within the network
Analyzes actual shipments against preferred zones by carrier and makes recommendations for better order routing throughout the pharmacy network
Works with both backend and frontend partners on weather event management and planning
Leads/Supports ad hoc Logistics projects where required
Supports new BI tool and Transportation Management System implementations
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelors’ Degree or Higher in Supply Chain, Business or another related field
5+ years of data analytics experience
3+ years of Carrier Logistics experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills with peers and leaders
Excellent presentation skills with peers and leaders
Autonomous and self-starter
Passion for making improvement within carrier network
Travel 5% annually
Expert Excel skills
SQL, SSRS, Tableau, PowerBI, dashboarding, carrier management, etc.

You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)

Job Title: Senior Logistics Analyst - Sulfuric Acid & Sulfur
Description:
Freeport-McMoRan is a leading international mining company with headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona. We operate large, long-lived, geographically diverse assets with significant proven and probable reserves of copper, gold, and molybdenum. The company has a dynamic portfolio of operating, expansion and growth projects in the copper industry. Freeport-McMoRan is one of the world’s largest publicly traded copper producers, the world’s largest producer of molybdenum and a significant gold producer. We have a long and successful history of conducting our business in a safe, highly efficient and socially-responsible manner.
We have the assets, the talent, the drive and the financial strength to provide attractive and rewarding careers of our employees. We encourage you to take the time to explore the opportunity to advance your career at Freeport-McMoRan.
Please note: This position has the possibility to work remotely up to 100% of the time. The position will require occasional travel to the Phoenix corporate offices and/or site locations. This position may be performed anywhere in the U.S. except California, New Hampshire, Michigan, Illinois and New York. Additional states may be excluded from remote work based on business factors. Should the position shift to in-office work in the future, the company will offer relocation benefits at that time should the position meet the established eligibility for these benefits.
Description
Manage and record Sulfur and Sulfuric Acid supply chain activity to ensure execution is on track to master plans and analyze variances to propose changes as necessary to maintain inventory balances across multiple sites. Identify obstacles in the logistics network and execute solutions in a prompt manner to prevent impacts to the supply chain. Develop and maintain business relationships with internal and external customers.
Monitor and analyze daily supply chain activity against master plan and propose changes and escalate as needed (consumption, production, and logistics)
Maintain timely and accurate inventory reporting/positions including on-site and in-transit material for both Sulfur and Sulfuric Acid
Track movements of Sulfur and Sulfuric Acid and coordinate with the transportation team and external suppliers on any issues
Manage metrics and reports for supplier and site performance and communicate results
Develop and maintain cross-functional internal relationships and external supplier relationships
Build an in depth understanding of the suppliers and logistics including capabilities and constraints
Provide backup support for team members
Perform other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree and three (3) years of experience in transportation, supply chain, business, or a related field
Intermediate Excel experience including the understanding of basic formula functions and chart creation
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, business, or logistics and three (3) years of experience in transportation, supply chain, business, or a related field
General understanding of systems tools including SAP, Microsoft Power BI, and Microsoft SharePoint
Criteria/Conditions:
Must be able to frequently sit, stand and walk.
Must be able to frequently lift and carry up to 10 pounds.
Must be able to work in a potentially stressful environment.
Personal protective equipment is required when performing work in a mine, outdoor, manufacturing or plant environment, including hard hat, hearing protection, safety glasses, safety footwear, and as needed, respirator, rubber steel-toe boots, protective clothing, gloves and any other protective equipment as required.
Freeport-McMoRan promotes a drug/alcohol-free work environment through the use of mandatory pre-employment drug testing and on-going random drug testing as allowed by applicable state laws
Freeport-McMoRan has reviewed the jobs at its various office and operating sites and determined that many of these jobs require employees to perform essential job functions that pose a direct threat to the safety or health of the employees performing these tasks or others. Accordingly, the Company has designated the following positions as safey-sensitive:
Site-based positions, or positions which require unescorted access to site-based operational areas, which are held by employees who are required to receive MSHA, OSHA, DOT, HAZWOPER and/or Hazard Recognition Training; or
Positions which are held by employees who operate equipment, machinery or motor vehicles in furtherance of performing the essential functions of their job duties, including operating motor vehicles while on Company business or travel (for this purpose "motor vehicles" includes Company owned or leased motor vehicles and personal vehicles used by employees in furtherance of Company business or while on Company travel); or
Positions which Freeport-McMoRan has designated as safety sensitive positions in the applicable job or position description and which upon further review continue to be designated as safety-sensitive based on an individualized assessment of the actual duties performed by a specifically identified employee.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability

Octo Consulting Group is seeking an Intermediate Integrated Logistics Support Analyst to join our growing team. The position requires an understanding of and experience with Army Acquisition logistics to provide effective operational support to a major U.S. Army enterprise network transformation program to deliver capabilities that provide the full spectrum of network and IT services for a globally connected Army. The Intermediate Integrated Logistics Specialist will manage various logistics tasks to support installing IT network equipment at multiple sites and will collaborate regularly with government Integrated Product Teams (IPT) to support the organization’s mission.


Us…

We were founded as a fresh alternative in the Government Consulting Community and are dedicated to the belief that results are a product of analytical thinking, agile design principles and that solutions are built in collaboration with, not for, our customers. This mantra drives us to succeed and act as true partners in advancing our client’s missions.


Program Mission…

The Program enables the Warfighter through information technology, infrastructure modernization, and life cycle management of the Army's CONUS Installation Campus Area (Voice, Video & Data) Networks, and strategic Command Centers across the Army. It provides a robust and scaleable networked information infrastructure that allows migration to a network-centric, knowledge-based operation, and enhances connectivity between forward deployed forces with CONUS installation infrastructure. It is a part of the joint effort to improve and protect Land War Net (LWN) by enhancing the infrastructure for better efficiency and effectiveness of the network and Army interoperability across the Department of Defense.
What we'd like to see...

Plan, integrate, coordinate, analyze, and evaluate Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) to support acquisitions and ongoing project installation
Develop ILS requirements
Assist with developing cost estimates and cost evaluations
Develop, as required, material fielding plans and documents per U.S. Army policies and procedures.
Coordinate and integrate with other contracting and operations personnel to assure efforts are coordinated and to identify and resolve problems
Manage staging warehouse and logistics processes to include shipping, receiving, storing, and issuing materiel and equipment per Army and program policies and procedures
Utilize the Defense Property Accountability System (DPAS) to develop material fielding plans and documents per Army policies and procedures.
Update the client on all logistics issues and supporting long-range program planning
Augment the program at various implementation meetings in person or via telecom/VTC such as weekly and quarterly status reviews and Systems Engineering reviews.
Provide logistics technical input in support developing Acquisitions documents.
Conduct accountability and management of organization installation property.
Provide logistics technical advice to the organization
Six (6) or more years of experience in Army/DoD logistics, or in industry supporting Army/DoD logistics.
Experience with property management processes and procedures.
Experience with Army Enterprise Systems Integration Program (AESIP), Cloud Equipping (cQuip), and Global Combat Support Systems-Army (GCSS-A)
Experience with managing logistics for goods and services on a worldwide scale.
Experience with issuing and managing hand receipts to ensure property accountability
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Outlook, MS Project, and Power Point.
Excellent communication skills (writing, speaking and listening).
Ability to effectively identify and elevate project/program risks and issues.
Self-starter able to manage tasks with little or no supervision


Desired Skills:

Experience with scheduling dependencies, risk, issues, performance, or decision support analyses
Experience with scheduling and conducting briefings
Understanding of government contracting, budgets, and costs
Knowledge and experience with Army protocol


Education:

Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent) from a recognized and accredited university, or equivalent years of experience

Clearance:

Active DOD Secret required

Principal Logistics Analyst
BUSINESS UNIT: Medtronic Operations
DEPARTMENT: Enterprise Transportation and Logistics :: Global Supply Chain
Careers that Change Lives | Impact patient outcomes. Come for a job, stay for a career.
As a Principal Logistics Analyst within the Global Supply Chain Enterprise Team you will provide support in the development and maintenance of business facing reports. You will support end-to-end supply chain activities to meet cost, service, and quality objectives for Enterprise Logistics. You will drive improvements in analytics and be a forward thinker with logistics strategies. You will deliver reporting projects from start to completion with minimal supervision. This role requires strong leadership skills, analysis, communication, and stakeholder engagement to deliver expected results in a rapidly-changing, fast-paced environment. This position will work within a matrixed organization, reporting to the Logistics Enterprise Senior Manager.
A DAY IN THE LIFE
You will:
•Project Management & Optimization
oManage multiple projects with minimal supervision.
oPrepare, manage, and analyze transportation cost optimization projects while driving best practices in transportation for sourcing and global freight operations.
oDrive education of core stakeholders on key supply chain strategies and policies to achieve broad alignment across stakeholders.
oUtilize Lean methodologies to identify and eliminate waste in the value chain.
oProvide options and recommendations to the business to balance cost, service, and inventory objectives.
oParticipate in contingency planning and risk management activities.
oDefine and document best-in-class procedures and playbooks for global team across a variety of scopes.
•Strategic Carrier Management
oManage relationships with MDT preferred carriers, analyze current business needs and carrier fit with logistics strategies.
oConduct regular review of logistics financial results and provide input into financial forecasting process.
oSupport RFP strategies and processes across multiple modes of transportation at a global level.
oPartner with Enterprise Control Tower and Regional Transportation teams to manage carrier performance.
oReview and monitor QBRs and KPIs; hold carriers accountable for quality, service, and performance.
oCreate best-in-class MBR/QBR standards and deliver roll-out plan to broader MDT Transportation teams to support uniformity and consistency.
•Operational Network Relationship Management
oManage relationships with Operational Network supply chain leaders, manufacturing sites, and partnership with DC operations.
oDrive cross functional collaboration on conformance to the freight policy, cost savings opportunities, and carrier utilization leveraging influence to drive process improvements and cost management.
SKILLS/COMPETENCIES
Self-starter and able to establish relationships and work with remote teams of professionals and able to work independently to achieve objectives.Knowledge and expertise regarding multiple modes of transportation.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, PC, and analytical skills (MS Suite).Ability to work collaboratively with cross department teams.Discretion with confidential or sensitive information.Demonstrates initiative, creativity, organizational ability and follow through.Self-motivated, aptitude for learning, passionate about generating/implementing new ideas.Capable of multitasking and working with changing priorities and deadlines.
•Travel 10%.
Must Have: Minimum Requirements
Bachelors degree required
Minimum of 7 years of relevant experience in Supply Chain, Logistics, or Transportation Management, or advanced degree with a minimum of 5 years relevant experience in Supply Chain, Logistics, or Transportation Management

Nice to Have
Previous roles in Global or Regional Transportation or Logistics Supply ChainExperience implementing or supporting a TMS (Transportation Management System)Excel power user (pivots, lookups, basic formulas, etc)Previous experience in operational optimization or supply chain project management

About Medtronic


Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Summary
Posted: Aug 28, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200263093
Imagine what you could do here! At Apple, we believe great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Are you passionate about driving the best supply chain for our customers? We hope you will consider joining our team. The Americas Logistics team is looking for an innovative and results driven Business Analyst. This team member will deliver business insights and KPIs across all of Logistics. They will also be responsible for stitching across all of Logistics to ensure end-to-end accountability of Logistics KPIs, driving a one logistics mindset. They should be able to verify numbers quickly, have confidence in the data, and be able to influence the business to move forward.
Key Qualifications
Experience building dashboards with Tableau, Python, and statistical models
Strong logistics knowledge to define KPIs that impact the customer
Have a deep understanding of the capabilities and limitations of different data systems and tools
Strong analytical thinking to help solve for logistical problems
Provide data-driven models and analyze data to drive the business and make key business decisions
Extensive experience in reporting, data mining, and ad hoc analytics tools
Prior knowledge of MySQL to define data requirements to data engineering and business process re-engineering teams
Basic understanding of Machine Learning or AI algorithms
Excellent presentation abilities
Excellent listening, verbal, and written communication skills
Description
Success requires an individual to think strategically, connecting the dots of the bigger picture, as well as being comfortable in the details of the all key deliverables. You must be self-motivated, comfortable working with minimal direction in a large, fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment. You have exceptional analytical skills, strong attention to detail, and a proven ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization. The position will require the ability to complete complex business analysis, develop and execute strategies, and be confident and competent as the face of Logistics in discussions with cross functional teams. The ideal candidate will have deep program management experience and be self-directed, motivated, and comfortable working in an extremely fast-paced environment. The duties and responsibilities are very diverse, but include the following: Work with logistics leaders to align on long-term KPIs Define and implement new and existing logistics KPIs using Tableau, Excel macros, & other tools Secure buy-in from key stakeholders and enlist their help in being part of the solution Clearly communicate the vision as well as the details of improvements in regular status updates with senior leaders Work closely with Business Process Re-Engineering and IT teams to manage and implement end-to-end process improvements Engage SMEs across regions and functions to understand their needs and most pressing issues Prioritize process improvements that balance the needs of different teams while providing the most overall benefit to Apple Ability to think in an unexpected way and influence peers with data-driven models Ability to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance of, others in sensitive situations Adapt at comprehending and working with large quantities of data from a variety of sources
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Operations, Business, Engineering, Logistics or related field required. MBA or advanced degree preferred.
Additional Requirements
Prior experience in jobs operating in complex supply chains, vendor management, and international transportation experience is desired.

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility
At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.

We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.
We are currently seeking a Logistics Analyst. This position requires a dynamic individual with a strong analytical background who will be responsible for analyzing data for the Logistics group.
Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.
You Will:
Interpret data on logistics elements, such as availability, maintainability, reliability, supply chain management, strategic sourcing or distribution, supplier management, or transportation.
Provide ongoing analyses in areas such as transportation costs, parts procurement, back orders, or delivery processes
Prepare reports on logistics performance measures
Confer with logistics management teams to determine ways to optimize service levels, maintain supply-chain efficiency, or minimize cost
Maintain databases of logistics information
Collate data from across the business
Ensure reliability, integrity and accuracy of data
Undertake detailed and thorough logistics analysis and identify opportunities to aid efficiency and cost optimization through evaluation of data
Ensure analysis is in line with business goals and targets
Create statistical and financial models and use appropriate software to review opportunities for cost savings and efficiencies in the logistics process, such as inventory levels, budget or transportation schedules
Make recommendations based on findings and analysis
Produce forecasts and estimates to aid financially sound decisions and cash flow planning
Ensure logistics costs are monitored, managed and under control
Collaborate with manager or stakeholders to determine effective solutions
Participate in regular planning reviews and change processes and prepare data in line with changes
Set up and provide regular reports and data relating to specific areas of the logistics process such as supplier analysis, transportation costs
Track logistics trends and use information to recommend changes
Utilize knowledge and research methods to benchmark logistics activities and to drive best practice results
Work with Logistics and other appropriate staff to resolve issues as and when required
Provide additional analytical support as required
Report against key performance indicators
Work towards and support a culture of continuous improvement and work to make business and department improvements wherever possible
You Bring:
5+ years of experience in any of the following areas: material flow, warehouse design, transportation management, dedicated fleet operations, distribution center management, materials handling, decision support systems and technology
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with success in working across organizations at all levels.
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects, effective project planning in terms of resources, strategies, cost, and time with ability to meet project timelines.
Experience with Materials requirements planning logistics and supply chain software, Enterprise resource planning ERP software, Analytical or scientific software, or Enterprise resource planning ERP software
Strong computer proficiency in MS Office applications
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred in Supply Chain, Logistics Engineering, Finance, Engineering or related field. An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience may be considered
LEAN, GK, or Six Sigma Certifications a plus

Thrasio is the consumer goods company reimagining omnichannel commerce and consumer products, and boasts an innovation engine that brings high-quality products to market across digital marketplaces, channels, and retailers globally.

With the experience of evaluating more than 6,000 Amazon companies, acquiring over 130 top-rated brands, and managing the scale of 22,000 products, Thrasio is the largest acquirer of Amazon FBA brands. Since our founding in 2018, the team has grown to more than 1,000 people globally-most of that growth has occurred during the COVID-19 pandemic. Hiring people who share a passion for their craft in the eCommerce space is the reason we’re projected to grow more than 10x in the next few years. This growth is supported by investors whose portfolios include Facebook, Google, Jet.com, StitchFix, and Lululemon. We do our best work when we’re surrounded by people who are insatiably curious, agile, and who thrive in collaborative, check-your-ego-at-the door working environments. Sound like you? We’d love to chat.
The Role
The International team is looking to add a Sales Analyst to analyze sales trends and track launches in International markets. This is a fast-paced environment, where we will be looking at brands and products in virtually all categories across Thrasio’s portfolio and tracking trends across multiple markets.
On this rapidly growing team, you will work hand-in-hand with our team to quickly analyze daily and weekly sales trends, inventory, sell-through, and other drivers of growth.
Responsibilities:
Analyze your ASIN level data (sales, conversion rate, sessions, costs, etc.) to determine why certain products are trending up or down; clearly articulate observations and propose strategies for troubleshooting.
Daily and/or Weekly Sales Analysis
Sales trend tracking and across product categories and country/region.
Inventory tracking and replenishment analysis
Pulling reports from multiple places and compiling results for tracking KPIs post launch
Working across the team to build reporting infrastructure and developing new processes and analytics that drive value add for all stakeholders
What you Bring to the Party:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Marketing, or equivalent practical experience
2-3 years' experience in an analytical function for a start-up or other fast-paced, high-growth company
Experience with online sales, Amazon is a plus
Experience with sales analysis, Amazon specific is a plus
Proven experience digging through data, running reports, drawing conclusions, and making data-driven decisions
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills and impeccable attention to detail.
THRASIO IS PROUD TO BE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER AND CONSIDERS ALL QUALIFIED APPLICANTS FOR EMPLOYMENT WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEX, GENDER, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY, ANCESTRY, AGE, OR NATIONAL ORIGIN. FURTHER, QUALIFIED APPLICANTS WILL NOT BE DISCRIMINATED AGAINST ON THE BASIS OF DISABILITY, PROTECTED CLASSES, OR PROTECTED VETERAN STATUS. THRASIO PARTICIPATES IN E-VERIFY.

Job Title: Analyst, Supply Chain Rotational Leadership Program
Description:
Analyst, Supply Chain Emerging Leader

Rotational Program

Analyst, Supply Chain Emerging Leader Rotational Program (JP-4PI20969)
Program Summary:
As we proactively prepare for future talent needs within VF’s Global Supply Chain organization, we have an opportunity to make a strategic difference by preparing for ongoing business success through outstanding contributors. The purpose of our Emerging Leader Rotational Program is to provide structured learning experiences to high potential individuals who add value and drive business success. Because of the program’s broad scope, these rotations provide exposure to key elements of our world class supply chain, including logistics, sustainability, distribution, operations and procurement. Over the course of 24 months, through four structured six-month rotations, you’ll learn about VF’s dynamic portfolio of brands and how we operate globally. You will also gain experience in and exposure to VF’s premiere end to end supply chain.
VF Corporation is seeking a highly talented and career-minded professionals starting July 2022 with their initial assignment located in either Denver, CO or Southern California. After completing the first two rotations, you will be moved to another VF location to provide further Supply Chain experience. After successfully completing the two-year program, graduates will be eligible for permanent placement into a VF SC Brand role and/or SC discipline located in North America. You must be willing to relocate for this opportunity.
 Depending on your interests and the company you’re interning with, you could be focusing on any number of areas including purchasing, inventory and distribution. Because of its broad scope, this internship offers a wonderful opportunity to gain exposure to several elements of a supply chainDepending on your interests and the company you’re interning with, you could be focusing on any number of areas including purchasing, inventory and distribution. Because of its broad scope, this internship offers a wonderful opportunity to gain exposure to several elements of a supply chain
What You’ll Do:
Assess business needs, define business requirements and source solutions to drive performance across all Supply Chain disciplines
Areas of work include Logistics, Sustainability, Supply Chain Central and Brand Operations, Distribution and Procurement. Within these functions you will analyze data to develop recommendations for process improvements
Perform moderately complex analysis of information, problems, and/or data under general supervision and make recommendations.
Engage key stakeholders in analyzing current SC processes and identifying ways of efficiency
Lead various mid-level supply chain projects, and works collaboratively across the SC organization to identify and recommend ways to streamline end-to-end processes
Assess processes involved in daily inbound/outbound product flow within a distribution center
Increase efficiency of the Distribution Center by participating in process improvement initiatives
Work with distribution leadership to analyze key performance indicators that are collected to measure performance of the distribution center, and compute metrics involving moderately complex issues.
Work with Operations (Supply, Demand, Replenishment, Forecasting, Planning, S & OP, etc.)
Be a supporting role in the development of implementing plans and execution of VF’s environmental sustainability program
Assist in measuring and reporting on environmental impact reduction targets
Present and communicate information to senior levels of the organization
Perform other assigned duties
What You’ll Gain:
Personal and Professional Development
Peer Networking Opportunities
Meaningful real-world work experience
Exposure to senior leadership and strategic business initiatives
Mentorship
What You’ll Need:
Upcoming Undergraduate or Master’s level degree in Supply Chain, Business, Management, Statistics, Engineering, or related discipline
Strong ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Outstanding analytical ability
Strong written and verbal communicator to various audiences including senior leadership
Proficiency in MS Office Suites (Strong emphasis on EXCEL)
Mobility: Must be willing to relocate
Salary Range:
$51,840.00 USD - $77,760.00 USD annually
Annual Incentive Eligibility :
This position is eligible to participate in VF's Annual Incentive Plan. Incentive Plan awards are contingent upon (1) achievement of your individual objectives and (2) VF achieving its' Corporate and business level financial objectives.
Long Term Incentive Eligibility :
This position is not eligible for long term incentive.
Benefits at VF :
You can review a general overview of each benefit program offered, including this year's medical plan rates on www.MyVFbenefits.com and clicking, Looking to Join VF? Detailed information on your benefits will be provided during your onboarding process.

Summary of Position (Job Purpose) - Major purpose and functions of the position. Provide operational and analytical support for all aspects of the Import Group. Works closely with the Import Management Team and personnel from other departments to facilitate supply chain processes. Improve department performance through analysis involving freight expense, carrier performance, procedural evaluations, carrier pricing and service proposals, and other new initiatives. Responsible for day-to-day operational execution, follow-up and customer service within the Import department.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities -
The primary tasks the associate will perform during his/her work schedule.
Duties and responsibilities
Maintain databases including drayage and ocean freight payments, fuel variance, accounts payables, dwell times and FDA records. Interpret data and analyze trends regarding freight availability, carrier reliability, drayage and freight costs and EDI accuracy. Confer with Import team to determine ways to optimize service levels, maintain supply-chain efficiency and minimize costs. Recommend improvements to existing processes and procedures. Specific Tasks

Imports Work with drayage providers to ensure deliveries to the distribution centers match weekly container projections. Communicate with the distribution center daily regarding deliveries and deconsolidation freight, and provide loading instructions and domestic carrier information. Track and trace containers from origin to final destination. Develop and analyze shipping data, generate reports, and identify opportunities for process improvement. Audit and process ocean freight, drayage and supplier management bills. Track seasonal and promotional merchandise as needed. Provide updates to buyers and ensure truckers prioritize delivery of these shipments. Analyze data flow between internal systems used by Dollar Tree to ensure no discrepancies occur. When errors occur, determine how they occurred and resolve each issue timely. Analyze and communicate FDA holds to all distribution centers daily. Complete other analysis, reporting, projects and duties as assigned by the Transportation management team.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications - Summary of knowledge, experience and education required.
Equivalent of 1+ year’s professional experience in Logistics, preferably in ocean transportation.
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience (at least 2 years of logistics work experience for non-bachelor degree holders).
Ability to work independently
Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, logistics procedures within the department and outside of the department.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and to meet project deadlines.
Ability to use MS excel to analyze data
Must be fully vaccinated from COVID-19, as defined by the CDC, by the date of hire. Proof of vaccination required. Request for medical or religious accommodation must be made prior to the start date

Desired Qualifications - Desired but not required. MS Access query building and database creation

This is not to be considered a complete list of job duties, as they may be amended or added to as needed .

At CEVA, we believe that logistics is a people business, that’s why we create an environment of trust and team spirit - we encourage initiative and we empower our talent to grow in their careers. We are supply chain experts and live and breathe it every day. We offer a broad range of services in Contract Logistics, Air, Ocean and Ground management thanks to our 78,000 employees, operating in more than 160 countries. At CEVA, we are passionate about our work and the value we deliver to our customers and as a company, we are growing at a fast pace - do you Dare to Grow with us?

YOUR ROLE
Are you known for your attention to detail and analytical skills? Are you passionate about delivering innovative support to supply chain customers? If so, we have an opportunity that would allow you to execute valuable responsibilities and contribute to delivering superior supply chain services.
WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?
Manage complete daily, weekly, and monthly reporting requirements for performance, compliance and invoicing, which requires report development and analytics. Perform a variety of calculations, analyses and audits of financial and operational results; typically involves fundamental professional related supply chain principles.
Analyze operational or transportation details to identify potential areas for improvement, savings or efficiency, including innovative solutions.
Oversee data integrity - review, classify, audit and record information within the appropriate systems or files; requires knowledge of professional related supply chain principles.
Ensure processes and operations comply with applicable laws, rules and regulations; seeking advice and interpretation when required.
Develop metrics and goals for programs, present information to customers or leaders and prepare templates or details to ensure operations are meeting expectations.
Review operational claims, failures or damages, perform root cause and other reviews to determine responsible parties, and present to leaders or internal and external customers.
Assist with reviewing and responding to customer requests, which includes applying transportation principles, drafting responses and outlines, and other professional support.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Transportation, Operations or Supply Chain Management or equivalent education and experience. Master’s Degree in related field preferred. Less than one-year related experience required.
Credentials: Professional certification may be required in some areas.
Skills: Ability to develop analytics, reports and communications related to transportation and logistics. Awareness of common systems and databases used for transportation and logistics management.
Characteristics: Capable of identifying areas to drive efficiency and operational effectiveness and ability to identify and communicate potential operational or analytical concerns.
WHAT DO WE HAVE TO OFFER?
With a genuine culture of recognition, we want our employees to grow, develop and be part of our journey. We offer a benefits package with a focus on your wellbeing. This includes competitive Paid Time Off, 401(k), health insurance and an employee benefits platform that offers discounts on gym memberships and a diverse range of retail, travel, and hospitality brands, including important offerings like pet insurance.
We are a team in every sense, and we support each other and work collaboratively to achieve our goals together.
It is our goal that you will be compensated for your hard work and commitment, so if you’d like to work for one of the top Logistics providers in the world then let’s work together to help you find your new role.
ABOUT TOMORROW
We value your professional and personal growth. That’s why we share plenty of career opportunities for you to thrive within CEVA. This role can be the first step on your career path with us. You can stay in the same job family, find a new family to grow in (an almost limitless number of options) or find your own path. Join CEVA for a challenging and rewarding career.
CEVA operates in a multicultural, global environment and is a richly diverse organization operating seamlessly as one company. We aim to attract, motivate and retain the best people in our industry, whatever their background. We share the same passion to deliver world-class solutions to our customers. We have the best supply chain professionals in the industry and develop this talent in an inspiring work environment.
CEVA Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunity work place and an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other characteristic. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individual with Disabilities.
Please note: Legitimate CEVA Logistics recruitment processes include communication with candidates through recognized professional networks, such as LinkedIn or via an official company email address: firstname.lastname@cevalogistics.com. We recommend that you do not respond to unsolicited business propositions and/or offers from people with whom you are unfamiliar.

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

As a Procurement Operations Analyst for the Amazon Fulfillment Center team, you will own the site’s indirect procurement operation responsibilities, including forecasting, inventory management, purchase order management and Vendor management of 3rd party service providers. You will lead supplier management KPI and metrics reporting, and work with stakeholders to find and understand deviation and improvement areas. You will provide procurement leadership and align with the building leadership team to drive efficiencies and improvements at the site(s).

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

In partnership with the Procurement Operations Manager, provide procurement operations support for the fulfillment center, including: forecasting of non-inventory products, inventory management, non-inventory flow and space models, cycle counts, supplier management, procurement transaction and expediting support
Lead team of non-inventory receivers to ensure building has adequate resources and is set up for success
Develop deep knowledge of non-inventory items and align with like buildings to drive best practices
Manage KPI to measure, control and benchmark procurement processes including creation of recurring metrics reports to drive improvements for the Operations network
Develop relationship across the building and network to ensure best practices are being shared and implemented
Align with internal customers, Finance and Procurement Operations to understand budgetary targets by building and develop methods of measuring and defining savings, value and other category metrics
Using input from the category team, build the category metrics model to track and monitor performance in relationship to the category strategy
Measure actual vs planned savings; as savings trends are identified, own action plans to meet goals and develop solutions
Work in partnership both internally and with suppliers to develop innovative solutions to provide Procurement support to the Operations network
Develop and implement ways to measure suppliers to drive continuous performance improvement on behalf of Amazon
Coordinate the demand identification, procurement, and inventory management of all non-merchandise items required for building operation. This includes corrugate, packing materials, labor and janitorial services, etc.
Partner with Category team to manage and maintain supplier scorecards

. Partner with AP, Suppliers and various internal teams to ensure timely resolution of vendor payment issues

Support the procurement operations and category management teams
Work is done in a warehouse environment that requires frequent walking around the building. You should feel comfortable working in an environment with varying temperatures as many buildings have dock doors that open throughout shifts.
Procurement experience preferred
Experience in Coupa or other financial management/procurement software
Experience with cost accounting
Lean / Six-Sigma knowledge
Must be highly self-motivated and customer-centric
Ability to work with ambiguity
Provide a positive customer experience internally and externally

Established as a private, not-for-profit organization in 1961, LMI is a trusted third party to federal civilian and defense agencies, free of commercial and political bias. Job Overview:

Procurement Analyst, Operations: The Analyst, Sourcing Activation is responsible for providing analytical, project management, and tactical executions support to create a reliable and flexible supplier network with an overall lower cost structure and improved efficiency. The Analyst works cross-functionally and supports efforts to integrate category strategies with related activities in the Supply Chain functions including Manufacturing, Quality, Supply Chain Planning, and Distribution. As a member of the Procurement Operations team, the Analyst’s role is to collaborate with procurement category managers to help facilitate key components of category strategies and process improvements resulting in improved supplier quality and service performance.
What you will do:
Quality & Service
Support efforts with the Procurement Team to advance the goals of the Quality and Service Pillar of the Procurement Operating Model including assist in the delivery of Supplier Quality and Service metrics, participate in the execution of improvement projects across the Supply Chain.
Assist in driving process and reporting improvements resulting in an efficient and effective Supplier Claims process, leveraging technology and connecting sites/users of the goods and services, with AP team.
Partners with cross functional teams to monitor and resolve issues around freight, import, and warehousing operations
Collaborate with the supplier quality team, category leads, and manufacturing to reduce non-conformance incidents, resolve outstanding claims, and improve fulfillment rates.
Provides support to in-bound leads at each manufacturing facility to secure on-time deliveries by suppliers while solidifying lead times.
Partner with supply chain team to eliminate waste in PO processing along with goods receipt practices.
Partner with cross functional teams to monitor and resolve issues around freight, import, and warehousing operations.
Working Capital/Productivity
Support vendor inventory management and supplier capacity planning in close collaboration with materials planning and category leads.
Monitor MOQs and Procurement/Supplier related inventory policies (ie VMI) to optimize inventory and minimize obsolescence at our KDP as well as suppliers’ sites.
Helps resolve invoicing issues and enable payment terms.
Other
Provides ad hoc support to Category Leads as assigned.
Collaborate with Category Leads and Supply Chain personnel to ensure effective Category Strategy integration through KDP’s supply chain.
Utilizes procurement tools including SAP, Ariba, Celonis, Cognos, and Kargoo Systems.
Identifies trends and improves procurement process and procedures and serves as SME for extended team.
Comfortable interacting with all levels of the organization, including senior executives.
Follow all KDP policies and procedures.
Requirements:

What you must have:
Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis on supply chain, data analytics, or Business Administration area of study.
3+ years’ experience in cross functional supply chain role(s)
Experience working with ERP systems, SAP Ariba preferred
Proficient in MS excel
Demonstrated experience creating and presenting reports and insights.
Strong communication skills.
Perform in fast paced environment with ever changing priorities.

KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America.
